jame joyc i state plump buck mulligan came from the stairhead bear a bowl of lather on which a mirror and a razor lay cross a yellow dressinggown ungirdl was sustain gentl behind him on the mild morn air he held the bowl aloft and inton introibo ad altar dei halt he peer down the dark wind stair and call out coars come up kinch come up you fear jesuit solemn he came forward and mount the round gunrest he face about and bless grave thrice the tower the surround land and the awak mountain then catch sight of stephen dedalus he bent toward him and made rapid cross in the air gurgl in his throat and shake his head stephen dedalus displeas and sleepi lean his arm on the top of the staircas and look cold at the shake gurgl face that bless him equin in it length and at the light untonsur hair grain and hu like pale oak buck mulligan peep an instant under the mirror and then cover the bowl smart back to barrack he said stern he ad in a preacher tone for this o dear belov is the genuin christin bodi and soul and blood and oun slow music pleas shut your eye gent one moment a littl troubl about those white corpuscl silenc all he peer sideway up and gave a long slow whistl of call then paus awhil in rapt attent his even white teeth glisten here and there with gold point chrysostomo two strong shrill whistl answer through the calm thank old chap he cri brisk that will do nice switch off the current will you he skip off the gunrest and look grave at his watcher gather about his leg the loos fold of his gown the plump shadow face and sullen oval jowl recal a prelat patron of art in the middl age a pleasant smile broke quiet over his lip the mockeri of it he said gaili your absurd name an ancient greek he point his finger in friend jest and went over to the parapet laugh to himself stephen dedalus step up follow him wearili halfway and sat down on the edg of the gunrest watch him still as he prop his mirror on the parapet dip the brush in the bowl and lather cheek and neck buck mulligan gay voic went on my name is absurd too malachi mulligan two dactyl but it has a hellen ring hasnt it trip and sunni like the buck himself we must go to athen will you come if i can get the aunt to fork out twenti quid he laid the brush asid and laugh with delight cri will he come the jejun jesuit ceas he began to shave with care tell me mulligan stephen said quiet yes my love how long is hain go to stay in this tower buck mulligan show a shaven cheek over his right shoulder god isnt he dread he said frank a ponder saxon he think your not a gentleman god these bloodi english burst with money and indigest becaus he come from oxford you know dedalus you have the real oxford manner he cant make you out o my name for you is the best kinch the knife blade he shave warili over his chin he was rave all night about a black panther stephen said where is his guncas a woful lunat mulligan said were you in a funk i was stephen said with energi and grow fear out here in the dark with a man i dont know rave and moan to himself about shoot a black panther you save men from drown im not a hero howev if he stay on here i am off buck mulligan frown at the lather on his razorblad he hop down from his perch and began to search his trouser pocket hastili scutter he cri thick he came over to the gunrest and thrust a hand into stephen upper pocket said lend us a loan of your noserag to wipe my razor stephen suffer him to pull out and hold up on show by it corner a dirti crumpl handkerchief buck mulligan wipe the razorblad neat then gaze over the handkerchief he said the bard noserag a new art colour for our irish poet snotgreen you can almost tast it cant you he mount to the parapet again and gaze out over dublin bay his fair oakpal hair stir slight god he said quiet isnt the sea what algi call it a grey sweet mother the snotgreen sea the scrotumtighten sea epi oinopa ponton ah dedalus the greek i must teach you you must read them in the origin thalatta thalatta she is our great sweet mother come and look stephen stood up and went over to the parapet lean on it he look down on the water and on the mailboat clear the harbourmouth of kingstown our mighti mother buck mulligan said he turn abrupt his grey search eye from the sea to stephen face the aunt think you kill your mother he said that whi she wont let me have anyth to do with you someon kill her stephen said gloomili you could have knelt down damn it kinch when your die mother ask you buck mulligan said im hyperborean as much as you but to think of your mother beg you with her last breath to kneel down and pray for her and you refus there is someth sinist in you he broke off and lather again light his farther cheek a toler smile curl his lip but a love mummer he murmur to himself kinch the loveliest mummer of them all he shave even and with care in silenc serious stephen an elbow rest on the jag granit lean his palm against his brow and gaze at the fray edg of his shini black coat sleev pain that was not yet the pain of love fret his heart silent in a dream she had come to him after her death her wast bodi within it loos brown gravecloth give off an odour of wax and rosewood her breath that had bent upon him mute reproach a faint odour of wet ash across the threadbar cuffedg he saw the sea hail as a great sweet mother by the wellf voic besid him the ring of bay and skylin held a dull green mass of liquid a bowl of white china had stood besid her deathb hold the green sluggish bile which she had torn up from her rot liver by fit of loud groan vomit buck mulligan wipe again his razorblad ah poor dogsbodi he said in a kind voic i must give you a shirt and a few noserag how are the secondhand breek they fit well enough stephen answer buck mulligan attack the hollow beneath his underlip the mockeri of it he said content secondleg they should be god know what poxi bowsi left them off i have a love pair with a hair stripe grey youll look spif in them im not joke kinch you look damn well when your dress thank stephen said i cant wear them if they are grey he cant wear them buck mulligan told his face in the mirror etiquett is etiquett he kill his mother but he cant wear grey trouser he fold his razor neat and with stroke palp of finger felt the smooth skin stephen turn his gaze from the sea and to the plump face with it smokeblu mobil eye that fellow i was with in the ship last night said buck mulligan say you have gpi hes up in dottyvill with connolli norman general paralysi of the insan he swept the mirror a half circl in the air to flash the tide abroad in sunlight now radiant on the sea his curl shaven lip laugh and the edg of his white glitter teeth laughter seiz all his strong wellknit trunk look at yourself he said you dread bard stephen bent forward and peer at the mirror held out to him cleft by a crook crack hair on end as he and other see me who chose this face for me this dogsbodi to rid of vermin it ask me too i pinch it out of the skivvi room buck mulligan said it doe her all right the aunt alway keep plainlook servant for malachi lead him not into temptat and her name is ursula laugh again he brought the mirror away from stephen peer eye the rage of caliban at not see his face in a mirror he said if wild were onli aliv to see you draw back and point stephen said with bitter it is a symbol of irish art the crack look glass of a servant buck mulligan sudden link his arm in stephen and walk with him round the tower his razor and mirror clack in the pocket where he had thrust them it not fair to teas you like that kinch is it he said kind god know you have more spirit than ani of them parri again he fear the lancet of my art as i fear that of his the cold steelpen crack lookingglass of a servant tell that to the oxi chap downstair and touch him for a guinea hes stink with money and think your not a gentleman his old fellow made his tin by sell jalap to zulus or some bloodi swindl or other god kinch if you and i could onli work togeth we might do someth for the island hellenis it cran arm his arm and to think of your have to beg from these swine im the onli one that know what you are whi dont you trust me more what have you up your nose against me is it hain if he make ani nois here ill bring down seymour and well give him a rag wors than they gave clive kempthorp young shout of money voic in clive kempthorp room palefac they hold their rib with laughter one clasp anoth o i shall expir break the news to her gentl aubrey i shall die with slit ribbon of his shirt whip the air he hop and hobbl round the tabl with trouser down at heel chase by ade of magdalen with the tailor shear a scare calf face gild with marmalad i dont want to be debag dont you play the giddi ox with me shout from the open window startl even in the quadrangl a deaf garden apron mask with matthew arnold face push his mower on the sombr lawn watch narrowli the danc mote of grasshalm to ourselv new pagan omphalo let him stay stephen said there noth wrong with him except at night then what is it buck mulligan ask impati cough it up im quit frank with you what have you against me now they halt look toward the blunt cape of bray head that lay on the water like the snout of a sleep whale stephen freed his arm quiet do you wish me to tell you he ask yes what is it buck mulligan answer i dont rememb anyth he look in stephen face as he spoke a light wind pass his brow fan soft his fair uncomb hair and stir silver point of anxieti in his eye stephen depress by his own voic said do you rememb the first day i went to your hous after my mother death buck mulligan frown quick and said what where i cant rememb anyth i rememb onli idea and sensat whi what happen in the name of god you were make tea stephen said and went across the land to get more hot water your mother and some visitor came out of the drawingroom she ask you who was in your room yes buck mulligan said what did i say i forget you said stephen answer o it onli dedalus whose mother is beast dead a flush which made him seem younger and more engag rose to buck mulligan cheek did i say that he ask well what harm is that he shook his constraint from him nervous and what is death he ask your mother or your or my own you saw onli your mother die i see them pop off everi day in the mater and richmond and cut up into tripe in the dissectingroom it a beast thing and noth els it simpli doesnt matter you wouldnt kneel down to pray for your mother on her deathb when she ask you whi becaus you have the curs jesuit strain in you onli it inject the wrong way to me it all a mockeri and beast her cerebr lobe are not function she call the doctor sir peter teazl and pick buttercup off the quilt humour her till it over you cross her last wish in death and yet you sulk with me becaus i dont whing like some hire mute from lalouett absurd i suppos i did say it i didnt mean to offend the memori of your mother he had spoken himself into bold stephen shield the gape wound which the word had left in his heart said veri cold i am not think of the offenc to my mother of what then buck mulligan ask of the offenc to me stephen answer buck mulligan swung round on his heel o an imposs person he exclaim he walk off quick round the parapet stephen stood at his post gaze over the calm sea toward the headland sea and headland now grew dim puls were beat in his eye veil their sight and he felt the fever of his cheek a voic within the tower call loud are you up there mulligan im come buck mulligan answer he turn toward stephen and said look at the sea what doe it care about offenc chuck loyola kinch and come on down the sassenach want his morn rasher his head halt again for a moment at the top of the staircas level with the roof dont mope over it all day he said im inconsequ give up the moodi brood his head vanish but the drone of his descend voic boom out of the stairhead and no more turn asid and brood upon love bitter mysteri for fergus rule the brazen car woodshadow float silent by through the morn peac from the stairhead seaward where he gaze inshor and farther out the mirror of water whiten spurn by lightshod hurri feet white breast of the dim sea the twine stress two by two a hand pluck the harpstr merg their twine chord wavewhit wed word shimmer on the dim tide a cloud began to cover the sun slowli wholli shadow the bay in deeper green it lay beneath him a bowl of bitter water fergus song i sang it alon in the hous hold down the long dark chord her door was open she want to hear my music silent with awe and piti i went to her bedsid she was cri in her wretch bed for those word stephen love bitter mysteri where now her secret old featherfan tassel dancecard powder with musk a gaud of amber bead in her lock drawer a birdcag hung in the sunni window of her hous when she was a girl she heard old royc sing in the pantomim of turko the terribl and laugh with other when he sang i am the boy he hack through the fri on the dish and slap it out on three plate say in nomin patri et filii et spiritus sancti hain sat down to pour out the tea im give you two lump each he said but i say mulligan kinswoman of mari ann buck mulligan face smile with delight charm he said in a finic sweet voic show his white teeth and blink his eye pleasant do you think she was quit charm then sudden overcloud about her whom they knew dewsilki cattl silk of the kine and poor old woman name given her in old time a wander crone lowli form of an immort serv her conqueror and her gay betray their common drank at her bid if we could live on good food like that he said to her somewhat loud we wouldnt have the countri full of rotten teeth and rotten gut live in a bogswamp eat cheap food and the street pave with dust horsedung and consumpt spit are you a medic student sir the old woman ask i am maam buck mulligan answer look at that now she said stephen listen in scorn silenc she bow her old head to a voic that speak to her loud her bonesett her medicineman me she slight to the voic that will shrive and oil for the grave all there is of her but her woman unclean loin of man flesh made not in god like the serpent prey and to the loud voic that now bid her be silent with wonder unsteadi eye do you understand what he say stephen ask her is it french you are talk sir the old woman said to hain hain spoke to her again a longer speech confid irish buck mulligan said is there gaelic on you i thought it was irish she said by the sound of it are you from the west sir i am an englishman hain answer hes english buck mulligan said and he think we ought to speak irish in ireland sure we ought to the old woman said and im asham i dont speak the languag myself im told it a grand languag by mad gaieti he move a doll head to and fro the brim of his panama hat quiver and began to chant in a quiet happi foolish voic im the queerest young fellow that ever you heard my mother a jew my father a bird with joseph the joiner i cannot agre so here to discipl and calvari he held up a forefing of warn if anyon think that i amnt divin hell get no free drink when im make the wine but have to drink stephen turn and saw that the cold gaze which had measur him was not all unkind after all i should think you are abl to free yourself you are your own master it seem to me i am a servant of two master mean the imperi british state stephen answer his colour rise and the holi roman cathol and apostol church hain detach from his underlip some fibr of tobacco befor he spoke i can quit understand that he said calm an irishman must think like that i daresay we feel in england that we have treat you rather unfair it seem histori is to blame the proud potent titl clang over stephen memori the triumph lay your on now say joe ay say i how are the mighti fallen collector of bad and doubt debt but that the most notori bloodi robber youd meet in a day walk and the face on him all pockmark would hold a arran quay ward gentleman hereinaft call the purchas videlicet five pound avoirdupoi of first choic tea at three shill and no penc per pound avoirdupoi and three stone avoirdupoi of sugar crush crystal at threepenc per pound avoirdupoi the said purchas debtor to the said vendor of one pound five shill and sixpenc sterl for valu receiv which amount shall be paid by said purchas to said vendor your opinion let us drink our pint in peac gob we wont be let even do that much itself well good health jack say ned good health ned say j j there he is again say joe where say alf and begob there he j was tell us there was an ancient hebrew zaretski or someth weep in the witnessbox with his hat on him swear by the holi mose he was stuck for two quid who tri the case say joe record say ned poor old sir frederick say alf you can cod him up to the two eye heart as big as a lion say ned tell him a tale of woe about arrear of rent and a sick wife and a squad of kid and faith hell dissolv in tear on the bench ay say alf reuben j was bloodi lucki he didnt clap him in the dock the other day for su poor littl gumley that mind stone for the corpor there near butt bridg and he start take off the old record let on to cri a most scandal thing this poor hardwork man how mani children ten did you say yes your worship and my wife has the typhoid and the wife with typhoid fever scandal leav the court immedi sir no sir ill make no order for payment how dare you sir come up befor me and ask me to make an order a poor hardwork industri man i dismiss the case and wherea on the sixteenth day of the month of the oxey goddess and in the third week after the feastday of the holi and undivid triniti the daughter of the sky the virgin moon be then in her first quarter it came to pass that those learn judg repair them to the hall of law there master courtenay sit in his own chamber gave his rede and master justic andrew sit without a juri in the probat court weigh well and ponder the claim of the first chargeant upon the properti in the matter of the will propound and final testamentari disposit in re the real and person estat of the late lament jacob halliday vintner deceas versus livingston an infant of unsound mind and anoth and to the solemn court of green street there came sir frederick the falcon and he sat him there about the hour of five oclock to administ the law of the brehon at the commiss for all that and those part to be holden in and for the counti of the citi of dublin and there sat with him the high sinhedrim of the twelv tribe of iar for everi tribe one man of the tribe of patrick and of the tribe of hugh and of the tribe of owen and of the tribe of conn and of the tribe of oscar and of the tribe of fergus and of the tribe of finn and of the tribe of dermot and of the tribe of cormac and of the tribe of kevin and of the tribe of caolt and of the tribe of ossian there be in all twelv good men and true and he conjur them by him who die on rood that they should well and truli tri and true deliver make in the issu join between their sovereign lord the king and the prison at the bar and true verdict give accord to the evid so help them god and kiss the book and they rose in their seat those twelv of iar and they swore by the name of him who is from everlast that they would do his rightwis and straightway the minion of the law led forth from their donjon keep one whom the sleuthhound of justic had apprehend in consequ of inform receiv and they shackl him hand and foot and would take of him ne bail ne mainpris but prefer a charg against him for he was a malefactor those are nice thing say the citizen come over here to ireland fill the countri with bug so bloom let on he heard noth and he start talk with joe tell him he neednt troubl about that littl matter till the first but if he would just say a word to mr crawford and so joe swore high and holi by this and by that hed do the devil and all becaus you see say bloom for an advertis you must have repetit that the whole secret reli on me say joe swindl the peasant say the citizen and the poor of ireland we want no more stranger in our hous o im sure that will be all right dark strong foami ale and utter his tribal slogan lamh dearg abu he drank to the undo of his foe a race of mighti valor hero ruler of the wave who sit on throne of alabast silent as the deathless god what up with you say i to lenehan you look like a fellow that had lost a bob and found a tanner gold cup say he who won mr lenehan say terri throwaway say he at twenti to one a rank outsid and the he keep your pecker up say joe shed have won the money onli for the other dog and j j and the citizen argu about law and histori with bloom stick in an odd word some peopl say bloom can see the mote in other eye but they cant see the beam in their own raimei say the citizen there no one as blind as the fellow that wont see if you know what that mean where are our miss twenti million of irish seem the leader of the parti sauci knave to us so say he knock loud with his swordhilt upon the open lattic mine host came forth at the summon gird him with his tabard give you good den my master said he with an obsequi bow bestir thyself sirrah cri he who had knock look to our steed and for ourselv give us of your best for ifaith we need it lackaday good master said the host my poor hous has but a bare larder i know not what to offer your lordship how now fellow cri the second of the parti a man of pleasant counten so servest thou the king messeng master taptun an instantan chang overspread the landlord visag cri you merci gentlemen he said humbl an you be the king messeng god shield his majesti you shall not want for aught the king friend god bless his majesti shall not go afast in my hous i warrant me then about cri the travel who had not spoken a lusti trencherman by his aspect hast aught to give us mine host bow again as he made answer what say you good master to a squab pigeon pasti some collop of venison a saddl of veal widgeon with crisp hog bacon a boar head with pistachio a bason of jolli custard a medlar tansi and a flagon of old rhenish gadzook cri the last speaker that isnt that a fact say john wyse what i was tell the citizen about bloom and the sinn fein that so say martin or so they alleg who made those alleg say alf i say joe im the allig and after all say john who is he no offenc crofton who is junius say j j we dont want him say crofter the orangeman or presbyterian hes a pervert jew say martin from a place in hungari and it was he drew up all the plan and everi male that born they think it may be their messiah and everi jew is in a tall state of excit i believ till he know if hes a father or a mother expect everi moment will be his next say lenehan that darl littl fellow with bright merri face and endear way about them they were dabbl in the sand with their spade and bucket build castl as children do or play with their big colour ball happi as the day was long and edi boardman was rock the chubbi babi to and fro in the pushcar while that young gentleman fair chuckl with delight he was but eleven month and nine day old and though still a tommi would have it right go wrong that it was to be architectur improv by a frontdoor like the martello tower had but if master tommi was headstrong master jacki was selfwil too and true to the maxim that everi littl irishman hous is his castl he fell upon his hate rival and to such purpos that the wouldb assail came to grief and ala to relat the covet castl too needless to say the cri of discomfit master tommi drew the attent of the girl friend come here tommi his sister call imper at onc and you jacki for shame to throw poor tommi in the dirti sand wait till i catch you for that his eye misti with unsh tear master tommi came at her call for their big sister word was law with the twin and in a sad plight he was too after his misadventur his littl man o war top and unmention were full of sand but cissi was a past mistress in the art of smooth over life tini troubl and veri quick not one speck of sand was to be seen on his smart littl suit still the blue eye were glisten with on the verg of tear cissi quick motherwit guess what was amiss and she whisper to edi boardman to take him there behind the pushcar where the gentleman couldnt see and to mind he didnt wet his new tan shoe but who was gerti gerti macdowel who was seat near her companion lost in thought gaze far away into the distanc was in veri truth as fair a specimen of winsom irish girlhood as one could wish to see she was pronounc beauti by all who knew her though as folk often said she was more a giltrap than a macdowel her figur was slight and grace inclin even to fragil but those iron jelloid she had been take of late had done her a world of good much better than the widow welch femal pill and she was much better of those discharg she use to get and that tire feel the waxen pallor of her face was almost spiritu in it ivorylik puriti though her rosebud mouth was a genuin cupid bow greek perfect her hand were of fine vein alabast with taper finger and as white as lemonjuic and queen of ointment could make them though it was not true that she use to wear kid glove in bed or take a milk footbath either bertha suppl told that onc to edi boardman a deliber lie when she was black out at dagger drawn with gerti the girl chum had of cours their littl tiff from time to time like the rest of mortal and she told her not to let on whatev she did that it was her that told her or shed never speak to her again no honour where honour is due there was an innat refin a languid queen hauteur about gerti which was unmistak evidenc in her delic hand and higharch instep had kind fate but will her to be born a gentlewoman of high degre in her own right and had she onli receiv the benefit of a good educ gerti macdowel might easili have held her own besid ani ladi in the land and have seen herself exquisit gown with jewel on her brow and patrician suitor at her feet vy with one anoth to pay their devoir to her mayhap it was this the love that might have been that lent to her softlyfeatur face at while a look tens with suppress mean that impart a strang yearn tendenc to the beauti eye a charm few could resist whi have women such eye of witcheri gerti were of the bluest irish blue set off by lustrous lash and dark express brow time was when those brow were not so silkili seduct it was madam vera veriti directress of the woman beauti page of the princess novelett who had first advis her to tri eyebrowlein which gave that haunt express to the eye so becom in leader of fashion and she had never regret it then there was blush scientif cure and how to be tall increas your height and you have a beauti face but your nose that would suit mrs dignam becaus she had a button one but gerti crown glori was her wealth of wonder hair it was dark brown with a natur wave in it she had cut it that veri morn on account of the new moon and it nestl about her pretti head in a profus of luxuri cluster and pare her nail too thursday for wealth and just now at edi word as a telltal flush delic as the faintest rosebloom crept into her cheek she look so love in her sweet girlish shyness that of a sureti god fair land of ireland did not hold her equal for an instant she was silent with rather sad downcast eye she was about to retort but someth check the word on her tongu inclin prompt her to speak out digniti told her to be silent the pretti lip pout awhil but then she glanc up and broke out into a joyous littl laugh which had in it all the fresh of a young may morn she knew right well no one better what made squinti edi say that becaus of him cool in his attent when it was simpli a lover quarrel as per usual somebodi nose was out of joint about the boy that had the bicycl off the london bridg road alway ride up and down in front of her window onli now his father kept him in in the even studi hard to get an exhibit in the intermedi that was on and he was go to go to triniti colleg to studi for a doctor when he left the high school like his brother w e wyli who was race in the bicycl race in triniti colleg univers littl reck he perhap for what she felt that dull ach void in her heart sometim pierc to the core yet he was young and perchanc he might learn to love her in time they were protest in his famili and of cours gerti knew who came first and after him the bless virgin and then saint joseph but he was undeni handsom with an exquisit nose and he was what he look everi inch a gentleman the shape of his head too at the back without his cap on that she would know anywher someth off the common and the way he turn the bicycl at the lamp with his hand off the bar and also the nice perfum of those good cigarett and besid they were both of a size too he and she and that was whi edi boardman thought she was so fright clever becaus he didnt go and ride up and down in front of her bit of a garden gerti was dress simpli but with the instinct tast of a votari of dame fashion for she felt that there was just a might that he might be out a neat blous of electr blue selftint by dolli dye becaus it was expect in the ladi pictori that electr blue would be worn with a smart vee open down to the divis and kerchief pocket in which she alway kept a piec of cottonwool scent with her favourit perfum becaus the handkerchief spoil the sit and a navi threequart skirt cut to the stride show off her slim grace figur to perfect she wore a coquettish littl love of a hat of wideleav nigger straw contrast trim with an underbrim of eggblu chenill and at the side a butterfli bow of silk to tone all tuesday week afternoon she was hunt to match that chenill but at last she found what she want at cleri summer sale the veri it slight shopsoil but you would never notic seven finger two and a penni she did it up all by herself and what joy was her when she tri it on then smile at the love reflect which the mirror gave back to her and when she put it on the waterjug to keep the shape she knew that that would take the shine out of some peopl she knew her shoe were the newest thing in footwear edi boardman pride herself that she was veri petit but she never had a foot like gerti macdowel a five and never would ash oak or elm with patent toecap and just one smart buckl over her higharch instep her wellturn ankl display it perfect proport beneath her skirt and just the proper amount and no more of her shape limb encas in finespun hose with highsplic heel and wide garter top as for undi they were gerti chief care and who that know the flutter hope and fear of sweet seventeen though gerti would never see seventeen again can find it in his heart to blame her she had four dinki set with aw pretti stitcheri three garment and nighti extra and each set slot with differ colour ribbon rosepink pale blue mauv and peagreen and she air them herself and blu them when they came home from the wash and iron them and she had a brickbat to keep the iron on becaus she wouldnt trust those washerwomen as far as shed see them scorch the thing she was wear the blue for luck hope against hope her own colour and lucki too for a bride to have a bit of blue somewher on her becaus the green she wore that day week brought grief becaus his father brought him in to studi for the intermedi exhibit and becaus she thought perhap he might be out becaus when she was dress that morn she near slip up the old pair on her insid out and that was for luck and lover meet if you put those thing on insid out or if they got unti that he was think about you so long as it wasnt of a friday and yet and yet that strain look on her face a gnaw sorrow is there all the time her veri soul is in her eye and she would give world to be in the privaci of her own familiar chamber where give way to tear she could have a good cri and reliev her pentup feelingsthough not too much becaus she knew how to cri nice befor the mirror you are love gerti it said the pali light of even fall upon a face infinit sad and wist gerti macdowel yearn in vain yes she had known from the veri first that her daydream of a marriag has been arrang and the weddingbel ring for mrs reggi wyli t c d becaus the one who marri the elder brother would be mrs wyli and in the fashion intellig mrs gertrud wyli was wear a sumptuous confect of grey trim with expens blue fox was not to be he was too young to understand he would not believ in love a woman birthright the night of the parti long ago in stoer he was still in short trouser when they were alon and he stole an arm round her waist she went white to the veri lip he call her littl one in a strang huski voic and snatch a half kiss the first but it was onli the end of her nose and then he hasten from the room with a remark about refresh impetu fellow strength of charact had never been reggi wyli strong point and he who would woo and win gerti macdowel must be a man among men but wait alway wait to be ask and it was leap year too and would soon be over no princ charm is her beau ideal to lay a rare and wondrous love at her feet but rather a man man with a strong quiet face who had not found his ideal perhap his hair slight fleck with grey and who would understand take her in his shelter arm strain her to him in all the strength of his deep passion natur and comfort her with a long long kiss it would be like heaven for such a one she yearn this balmi summer eve with all the heart of her she long to be his onli his affianc bride for rich for poor in sick in health till death us two part from this to this day forward and while edi boardman was with littl tommi behind the pushcar she was just think would the day ever come when she could call herself his littl wife to be then they could talk about her till they went blue in the face bertha suppl too and edi littl spitfir becaus she would be twentytwo in novemb she would care for him with creatur comfort too for gerti was woman wise and knew that a mere man like that feel of homi her griddlecak done to a goldenbrown hue and queen ann pud of delight creami had won golden opinion from all becaus she had a lucki hand also for light a fire dredg in the fine selfrais flour and alway stir in the same direct then cream the milk and sugar and whisk well the white of egg though she didnt like the eat part when there were ani peopl that made her shi and often she wonder whi you couldnt eat someth poetic like violet or rose and they would have a beauti appoint drawingroom with pictur and engrav and the photograph of grandpapa giltrap love dog garryowen that almost talk it was so human and chintz cover for the chair and that silver toastrack in cleri summer jumbl sale like they have in rich hous he would be tall with broad shoulder she had alway admir tall men for a husband with glisten white teeth under his care trim sweep moustach and they would go on the contin for their honeymoon three wonder week and then when they settl down in a nice snug and cosi littl home hous everi morn they would both have brekki simpl but perfect serv for their own two selv and befor he went out to busi he would give his dear littl wifey a good hearti hug and gaze for a moment deep down into her eye edi boardman ask tommi caffrey was he done and he said yes so then she button up his littl knickerbock for him and told him to run off and play with jacki and to be good now and not to fight but tommi said he want the ball and edi told him no that babi was play with the ball and if he took it there be wig on the green but tommi said it was his ball and he want his ball and he pranc on the ground if you pleas the temper of him o he was a man alreadi was littl tommi caffrey sinc he was out of pinni edi told him no no and to be off now with him and she told cissi caffrey not to give in to him your not my sister naughti tommi said it my ball but cissi caffrey told babi boardman to look up look up high at her finger and she snatch the ball quick and threw it along the sand and tommi after it in full career have won the day anyth for a quiet life laugh ciss and she tickl tini tot two cheek to make him forget and play here the lord mayor here his two hors here his gingerbread carriag and here he walk in chinchopp chinchopp chinchopp chin but edi got as bent down her head and crimson at the idea of cissi say an unladylik thing like that out loud shed be asham of her life to say flush a deep rosi red and edi boardman said she was sure the gentleman opposit heard what she said but not a pin care ciss let him she said with a pert toss of her head and a piquant tilt of her nose give it to him too on the same place as quick as id look at him madcap ciss with her golliwog curl you had to laugh at her sometim for instanc when she ask you would you have some more chines tea and jaspberri ram and when she drew the jug too and the men face on her nail with red ink make you split your side or when she want to go where you know she said she want to run and pay a visit to the miss white that was just like cissycum o and will you ever forget her the even she dress up in her father suit and hat and the burn cork moustach and walk down tritonvill road smoke a cigarett there was none to come up to her for fun but she was sincer itself one of the bravest and truest heart heaven ever made not one of your twofac thing too sweet to be wholesom and then there came out upon the air the sound of voic and the peal anthem of the organ it was the men temper retreat conduct by the mission the reverend john hugh s j rosari sermon and benedict of the most bless sacrament they were there gather togeth without distinct of social class and a most edifi merci and gerti rapt in thought scarc saw or heard her companion or the twin at their boyish gambol or the gentleman off sandymount green that cissi caffrey call the man that was so like himself pass to woo thee or my love and cottag near rochell and they had stew cockl and lettuc with lazenbi salad dress for supper and when he sang the moon hath rais with mr dignam that die sudden and was buri the gout and she had to go into town to bring him the letter and sampl from his offic about catesbi cork lino artist standard design fit for a palac give tiptop wear and alway bright and cheeri in the home a sterl good daughter was gerti just like a second mother in the hous a minist angel too with a littl heart worth it weight in gold and when her mother had those rage split headach who was it rub the menthol cone on her forehead but gerti though she didnt like her mother take pinch of snuff and that was the onli singl thing they ever had word about take snuff everyon thought the world of her the girlwoman went out to him her dreamhusband becaus she knew on the instant it was him if he had suffer more sin against than sin or even even if he had been himself a sinner a wick man she care not ganderi stride it was a wonder she didnt rip up her skirt at the side that was too tight on her becaus there was a lot of the tomboy about cissi caffrey and she was a forward piec whenev she thought noth els matter come what might she would be wild untrammel free canon ohanlon put the bless sacrament back into the tabernacl and genuflect and the choir sang laudat dominum omn gent and then he lock of be at their beck and call if they could run like rossi she could sit so she said she could see from where she was the eye that were fasten upon her set her puls tingl she look at him a moment meet delic round and she seem to hear the pant of his heart his hoars breath becaus she knew too about the passion of men like that hotblood becaus bertha suppl told her onc in dead secret and made her swear shed never about the gentleman lodger that was stay with them out of the congest district board that had pictur cut out of paper of those skirtdanc and highkick and she said he use to do someth not veri nice that you could imagin sometim in the bed but this was altogeth differ from a thing like that becaus there was all the differ becaus she could almost feel him draw her face to his and the first quick hot touch of his handsom lip besid there was absolut so long as you didnt do the other thing befor be marri and there ought to be women priest that would understand without your tell out and cissi caffrey too sometim had that dreami kind of dreami look in her eye so that she too my dear and winni rippingham so mad about actor photograph and besid it was on account of that other thing come on the way it did and jacki caffrey shout to look there was anoth and she lean back and the garter were blue to match on account of the transpar and they all saw it and they all shout to look look there it was and she lean back ever so far to see the firework and someth queer was fli through the air a soft thing to and fro dark and she saw a long roman candl go up over the tree up up and in the tens hush they were all breathless with excit as it went higher and higher and she had to lean back more and more to look up after it high high almost out of sight and her face was suffus with a divin an entranc blush from strain back and he could see her other thing too nainsook knicker the fabric that caress the skin better than those other pettiwidth the green four and eleven on account of be white and she let him and she saw that he saw and then it went so high it went out of sight a moment and she was trembl in everi limb from be bent so far back that he had a full view high up abov her knee where no one ever not even on the swing or wade and she wasnt asham and he wasnt either to look in that immodest way like that becaus he couldnt resist the sight of the wondrous reveal half offer like those skirtdanc behav so immodest befor gentlemen look and he kept on look look she would fain have cri to him choke held out her snowi slender arm to him to come to feel his lip laid on her white brow the cri of a young girl love a littl strangl cri wrung from her that cri that has rung through the age and then a rocket sprang and bang shot blind blank and o then the roman candl burst and it was like a sigh of o and everyon cri o o in raptur and it gush out of it a stream of rain gold hair thread and they shed and ah they were all greeni dewi star fall with golden o so love o soft sweet soft then all melt away dewili in the grey air all was silent ah she glanc at him as she bent forward quick a pathet littl glanc of piteous protest of shi reproach under which he colour call to him and wretch that he was how had he answer an utter cad he had been he of all men but there was an infinit store of merci in those eye for him too a word of pardon even though he had er and sin and wander should a girl tell no a thousand time no that was their secret onli their alon in the hide twilight and there was none to know or tell save the littl bat that flew so soft through the up gerti had an idea one of love littl ruse she slip a hand into her kerchief pocket and took out the wad and wave in repli of cours without let him and then slip it back wonder if hes too far to she
