her grow pain at night call waken me frighten she was when her natur came on her first poor child strang moment for the mother too bring back her girlhood gibraltar look from buena vista ohara tower the seabird scream old barbari ape that gobbl all his famili sundown gunfir for the men to cross the line look out over the sea she told me even like this but clear no cloud i alway thought id marri a lord or a rich gentleman come with a privat yacht buena noch senorita el hombr ama la muchacha hermosa whi me becaus you were so foreign from the other better not stick here all night like a limpet this weather make you dull must be get on for nine by the light go home too late for leah lili of killarney no might be still up call to the hospit to see hope shes over long day ive had martha the bath funer hous of key museum with those goddess dedalus song then that bawler in barney kiernan got my own back there drunken ranter what i said about his god made him winc mistak to hit back or no ought to go home and laugh at themselv alway want to be swill in compani afraid to be alon like a child of two suppos he hit me look at it other way round not so bad then perhap not to hurt he meant three cheer for israel three cheer for the sister in law he hawk about three fang in her mouth same style of beauti particular nice old parti for a cup of tea the sister of the wife of the wild man of borneo has just come to town imagin that in the earli morn at close rang everyon to his tast as morri said when he kiss the cow but dignam put the boot on it hous of mourn so depress becaus you never know anyhow she want the money must call to those scottish widow as i promis strang name take it for grant were go to pop off first that widow on monday was it outsid cramer that look at me buri the poor husband but progress favour on the premium her widow mite well what do you expect her to do must wheedl her way along widow i hate to see look so forlorn poor man oconnor wife and five children poison by mussel here the sewag hopeless some good matron woman in a porkpi hat to mother him take him in tow platter face and a larg apron ladi grey flannelett bloomer three shill a pair astonish bargain plain and love love for ever they say ugli no woman think she is love lie and be handsom for tomorrow we die see him sometim walk about tri to find out who play the trick u p up fate that is he not me also a shop often notic curs seem to dog it dreamt last night wait someth confus she had red slipper on turkish wore the breech suppos she doe would i like her in pyjama damn hard to answer nannetti gone mailboat near holyhead by now must nail that ad of keyess work hyne and crawford petticoat for molli she has someth to put in them what that might be money mr bloom stoop and turn over a piec of paper on the strand he brought it near his eye and peer letter no cant read better go better im tire to move page of an old copybook all those hole and pebbl who could count them never know what you find bottl with stori of a treasur in it thrown from a wreck parcel post children alway want to throw thing in the sea trust bread cast on the water what this bit of stick o exhaust that femal has me not so young now will she come here tomorrow wait for her somewher for ever must come back murder do will i mr bloom with his stick gentl vex the thick sand at his foot write a messag for her might remain what i some flatfoot tramp on it in the morn useless wash away tide come here saw a pool near her foot bend see my face there dark mirror breath on it stir all these rock with line and scar and letter o those transpar besid they dont know what is the mean of that other world i call you naughti boy becaus i do not like am a no room let it go mr bloom effac the letter with his slow boot hopeless thing sand noth grow in it all fade no fear of big vessel come up here except guinnesss barg round the kish in eighti day done half by design he flung his wooden pen away the stick fell in silt sand stuck now if you were tri to do that for a week on end you couldnt chanc well never meet again but it was love goodby dear thank made me feel so young short snooz now if i had must be near nine liverpool boat long gone not even the smoke and she can do the other did too and belfast i wont go race there race back to enni let him just close my eye a moment wont sleep though half dream it never come the same bat again no harm in him just a few o sweeti all your littl girlwhit up i saw dirti bracegirdl made me do love sticki we two naughti grace darl she him half past the bed met him pike hose frilli for raoul de perfum your wife black hair heav under embon senorita young eye mulvey plump bub me breadvan winkl red slipper she rusti sleep wander year of dream return tail end agendath swooni lovey show me her next year in drawer return next in her next her next a bat flew here there here far in the grey a bell chime mr bloom with open mouth his left boot sand sideway lean breath just for a few cuckoo cuckoo cuckoo the clock on the mantelpiec in the priest hous coo where canon ohanlon and father conroy and the reverend john hugh s j were take tea and sodabread and butter and fri mutton chop with catsup and talk about cuckoo cuckoo cuckoo becaus it was a littl canarybird that came out of it littl hous to tell the time that gerti macdowel notic the time she was there becaus she was as quick as anyth about a thing like that was gerti macdowel and she notic at onc that that foreign gentleman that was sit on the rock look was cuckoo cuckoo cuckoo deshil holl eamus deshil holl eamus deshil holl eamus send us bright one light one horhorn quicken and wombfruit send us bright one light one horhorn quicken and wombfruit send us bright one light one horhorn quicken and wombfruit hoopsa boyaboy hoopsa hoopsa boyaboy hoopsa hoopsa boyaboy hoopsa univers that person acumen is esteem veri littl percept concern whatsoev matter are be held as most profit by mortal with sapienc endow to be studi who is ignor of that which the most in doctrin erudit and certain by reason of that in them high mind ornament deserv of vener constant maintain when by general consent they affirm that other circumst be equal by no exterior splendour is the prosper of a nation more efficaci assert than by the measur of how far forward may have progress the tribut of it solicitud for that prolifer continu which of evil the origin if it be absent when fortun present constitut the certain sign of omnipot natur incorrupt benefact for who is there who anyth of some signific has apprehend but is conscious that that exterior splendour may be the surfac of a downwardtend lutul realiti or on the contrari anyon so is there unillumin as not to perceiv that as no natur boon can contend against the bounti of increas so it behov everi most just citizen to becom the exhort and admonish of his semblabl and to trembl lest what had in the past been by the nation excel commenc might be in the futur not with similar excel accomplish if an inverecund habit shall have gradual traduc the honour by ancestor transmit custom to that thither of profund that that one was audaci excess who would have the hardihood to rise affirm that no more odious offenc can for anyon be than to oblivi neglect to consign that evangel simultan command and promis which on all mortal with propheci of abund or with diminut menac that exalt of reiter procreat function ever irrevoc enjoin it is not whi therefor we shall wonder if as the best historian relat among the celt who noth that was not in it natur admir admir the art of medicin shall have been high honour not to speak of hostel leperyard sweat chamber plaguegrav their greatest doctor the oshiel the ohickey the ole have sedul set down the diver method by which the sick and the relaps found again health whether the maladi had been the trembl wither or loos boyconnel flux certain in everi public work which in it anyth of graviti contain prepar should be with import commensur and therefor a plan was by them adopt whether by have preconsid or as the matur of experi it is difficult in be said which the discrep opinion of subsequ inquir are not up to the present congru to render manifest wherebi matern was so far from all accid possibl remov that whatev care the patient in that all hardest of woman hour chiefli requir and not sole for the copious opul but also for her who not be suffici money scarc and often not even scarc could subsist valiant and for an inconsider emolu was provid to her noth alreadi then and thenceforward was anyway abl to be molest for this chiefli felt all citizen except with prolifer mother prosper at all not to can be and as they had receiv etern god mortal generat to befit them her behold when the case was so hove itself parturi in vehicl thereward carri desir immens among all one anoth was impel on of her to be receiv into that domicil o thing of prudent nation not mere in be seen but also even in be relat worthi of be prais that they her by anticip went see mother that she by them sudden to be about to be cherish had been begun she felt befor born bliss babe had within womb won he worship whatev in that one case done commodi done was a couch by midwiv attend with wholesom food repos cleanest swaddl as though forthbring were now done and by wise foresight set but to this no less of what drug there is need and surgic implement which are pertain to her case not omit aspect of all veri distract spectacl in various latitud by our terrestri orb offer togeth with imag divin and human the cogit of which by sejunct femal is to tumesc conduc or eas issu in the high sunbright wellbuilt fair home of mother when ostens far gone and reproductit it is come by her thereto to lie in her term up some man that wayfar was stood by housedoor at night oncom of israel folk was that man that on earth wander far had fare stark ruth of man his errand that him lone led till that hous of that hous a horn is lord seventi bed keep he there teem mother are wont that they lie for to thole and bring forth bairn hale so god angel to mari quoth watcher tway there walk white sister in ward sleepless smart they still sick sooth in twelv moon thrice an hundr truest bedthan they twain are for horn hold wariest ward in ward wari the watcher hear come that man mildheart eft rise with swire ywimpl to him her gate wide undid lo levin leap lighten in eyeblink ireland westward welkin full she drad that god the wreaker all mankind would fordo with water for his evil sin christ rood made she on breastbon and him drew that he would rath infar under her thatch that man her will wot worth went in horn hous loth to irk in horn hall hat hold the seeker stood on her stow he ere was live with dear wife and lovesom daughter that then over land and seafloor nine year had long outwand onc her in townhith meet he to her bow had not dof her to forgiv now he crave with good ground of her allow that that of him swiftseen face her so young then had look light swift her eye kindl bloom of blush his word win as her eye then ongot his weed swart therefor sorrow she fear glad after she was that ere adread was her he ask if ohar doctor tide sent from far coast and she with grame sigh him answer that ohar doctor in heaven was sad was the man that word to hear that him so heavi in bowel ruth all she there told him ru death for friend so young algat sore unwil god rightwis to withsay she said that he had a fair sweet death through god his good with masspriest to be shriven holi housel and sick men oil to his limb the man then right earnest ask the nun of which death the dead man was die and the nun answer him and said that he was die in mona island through bellycrab three year agon come childerma and she pray to god the allruth to have his dear soul in his undeathli he heard her sad word in held hat sad stare so stood they there both awhil in wanhop sorrow one with other therefor everyman look to that last end that is thi death and the dust that gripeth on everi man that is born of woman for as he came nake forth from his mother womb so nake shall he wend him at the last for to go as he came the man that was come in to the hous then spoke to the nursingwoman and he ask her how it fare with the woman that lay there in childb the nursingwoman answer him and said that that woman was in throe now full three day and that it would be a hard birth unneth to bear but that now in a littl it would be she said thereto that she had seen mani birth of women but never was none so hard as was that woman birth then she set it all forth to him for becaus she knew the man that time was had live nigh that hous the man hearken to her word for he felt with wonder women woe in the travail that they have of motherhood and he wonder to look on her face that was a fair face for ani man to see but yet was she left after long year a handmaid nine twelv bloodflow chide her childless and while they spake the door of the castl was open and there nigh them a mickl nois as of mani that sat there at meat and there came against the place as they stood a young learningknight yclept dixon and the travel leopold was couth to him sithen it had hap that they had had ado each with other in the hous of misericord where this learningknight lay by caus the travel leopold came there to be heal for he was sore wound in his breast by a spear wherewith a horribl and dread dragon was smitten him for which he did do make a salv of volatil salt and chrism as much as he might suffic and he said now that he should go in to that castl for to make merri with them that were there and the travel leopold said that he should go otherwhith for he was a man of cautel and a subtil also the ladi was of his avi and reprev the learningknight though she trow well that the travel had said thing that was fals for his subtil but the learningknight would not hear say nay nor do her mandement ne have him in aught contrari to his list and he said how it was a marvel castl and the travel leopold went into the castl for to rest him for a space be sore of limb after mani march environ in diver land and sometim veneri and in the castl was set a board that was of the birchwood of finlandi and it was upheld by four dwarfmen of that countri but they durst not move more for enchant and on this board were fright sword and knive that are made in a great cavern by swink demon out of white flame that they fix then in the horn of buffalo and stag that there abound marvel and there were vessel that are wrought by magic of mahound out of seasand and the air by a warlock with his breath that he blase in to them like to bubbl and full fair cheer and rich was on the board that no wight could devis a fuller ne richer and there was a vat of silver that was move by craft to open in the which lay strang fish withouten head though misbeliev men nie that this be possibl thing without they see it natheless they are so and these fish lie in an oili water brought there from portug land becaus of the fat that therein is like to the juic of the olivepress and also it was a marvel to see in that castl how by magic they make a compost out of fecund wheatkidney out of chalde that by aid of certain angri spirit that they do in to it swell up wondrous like to a vast mountain and they teach the serpent there to entwin themselv up on long stick out of the ground and of the scale of these serpent they brew out a brewag like to mead and the learn knight let pour for child leopold a draught and halp thereto the while all they that were there drank everi each and child leopold did up his beaver for to pleasur him and took apert somewhat in amiti for he never drank no manner of mead which he then put by and anon full privili he void the more part in his neighbour glass and his neighbour nist not of this wile and he sat down in that castl with them for to rest him there awhil thank be almighti god this meanwhil this good sister stood by the door and beg them at the rever of jesu our alther lieg lord to leav their wassail for there was abov one quick with child a gentl dame whose time hie fast sir leopold heard on the upfloor cri on high and he wonder what cri that it was whether of child or woman and i marvel said he that it be not come or now meseem it dureth overlong and he was ware and saw a franklin that hight lenehan on that side the tabl that was older than ani of the tother and for that they both were knight virtuous in the one empris and eke by caus that he was elder he spoke to him full gentl but said he or it be long too she will bring forth by god his bounti and have joy of her child for she hath wait marvel long and the franklin that had drunken said expect each moment to be her next also he took the cup that stood tofor him for him need never none ask nor desir of him to drink and now drink said he fulli delect and he quaf as far as he might to their both health for he was a pass good man of his lusti and sir leopold that was the goodliest guest that ever sat in scholar hall and that was the meekest man and the kindest that ever laid husband hand under hen and that was the veri truest knight of the world one that ever did minion servic to ladi gentl pledg him court in the cup woman woe with wonder ponder now let us speak of that fellowship that was there to the intent to be drunken an they might there was a sort of scholar along either side the board that is to wit dixon yclept junior of saint mari merciabl with other his fellow lynch and madden scholar of medicin and the franklin that hight lenehan and one from alba longa one crotther and young stephen that had mien of a frere that was at head of the board and costello that men clepen punch costello all long of a masteri of him erewhil gest and of all them reserv young stephen he was the most drunken that demand still of more mead and besid the meek sir leopold but on young malachi they wait for that he promis to have come and such as intend to no good said how he had broke his avow and sir leopold sat with them for he bore fast friendship to sir simon and to this his son young stephen and for that his languor becalm him there after longest wander insomuch as they feast him for that time in the honourablest manner ruth red him love led on with will to wander loth to leav for they were right witti scholar and he heard their aresoun each gen other as touch birth and righteous young madden maintain that put such case it were hard the wife to die for so it had fallen out a matter of some year agon with a woman of eblana in horn hous that now was trespass out of this world and the self night next befor her death all leech and pothecari had taken counsel of her case and they said farther she should live becaus in the begin they said the woman should bring forth in pain and wherefor they that were of this imagin affirm how young madden had said truth for he had conscienc to let her die and not few and of these was young lynch were in doubt that the world was now right evil govern as it was never other howbeit the mean peopl believ it otherwis but the law nor his judg did provid no remedi a redress god grant this was scant said but all cri with one acclaim nay by our virgin mother the wife should live and the babe to die in colour whereof they wax hot upon that head what with argument and what for their drink but the franklin lenehan was prompt each when to pour them ale so that at the least way mirth might not lack then young madden show all the whole affair and said how that she was dead and how for holi religion sake by rede of palmer and bedesman and for a vow he had made to saint ultan of arbraccan her goodman husband would not let her death wherebi they were all wondrous griev to whom young stephen had these word follow murmur sir is eke oft among lay folk both babe and parent now glorifi their maker the one in limbo gloom the other in purgefir but gramerci what of those godposs soul that we night impossibilis which is the sin against the holi ghost veri god lord and giver of life for sir he said our lust is brief we are mean to those small creatur within us and natur has other end than we then said dixon junior to punch costello wist he what end but he had overmuch drunken and the best word he could have of him was that he would ever dishonest a woman whoso she were or wife or maid or leman if it so fortun him to be deliv of his spleen of lustihead whereat crotther of alba longa sang young malachi prais of that beast the unicorn how onc in the millennium he cometh by his horn the other all this while prick forward with their jibe wherewith they did malic him wit all and sever by saint foutinus his engin that he was abl to do ani manner of thing that lay in man to do thereat laugh they all right jocund onli young stephen and sir leopold which never durst laugh too open by reason of a strang humour which he would not bewray and also for that he ru for her that bare whoso she might be or wheresoev then spake young stephen orgul of mother church that would cast him out of her bosom of law of canon of lilith patron of abort of big wrought by wind of seed of bright or by potenc of vampir mouth to mouth or as virgilius saith by the influenc of the occid or by the reek of moonflow or an she lie with a woman which her man has but lain with effectu secuto or peradventur in her bath accord to the opinion of averro and mose maimonid he said also how at the end of the second month a human soul was infus and how in all our holi mother foldeth ever soul for god greater glori wherea that earth mother which was but a dam to bear beast should die by canon for so saith he that holdeth the fisherman seal even that bless peter on which rock was holi church for all age found all they bachelor then ask of sir leopold would he in like case so jeopard her person as risk life to save life a wari of mind he would answer as fit all and lay hand to jaw he said dissembl as his wont was that as it was inform him who had ever love the art of physic as might a layman and agre also with his experi of so seldomseen an accid it was good for that mother church belik at one blow had birth and death penc and in such sort deliv he scape their question that is truth pardi said dixon and or i err a pregnant word which hear young stephen was a marvel glad man and he aver that he who stealeth from the poor lendeth to the lord for he was of a wild manner when he was drunken and that he was now in that take it appear eftsoon but sir leopold was pass grave maugr his word by caus he still had piti of the terrorcaus shriek of shrill women in their labour and as he was mind of his good ladi marion that had born him an onli manchild which on his eleventh day on live had die and no man of art could save so dark is destini and she was wondrous stricken of heart for that evil hap and for his burial did him on a fair corselet of lamb wool the flower of the flock lest he might perish utter and lie akel for it was then about the midst of the winter and now sir leopold that had of his bodi no manchild for an heir look upon him his friend son and was shut up in sorrow for his forepass happi and as sad as he was that him fail a son of such gentl courag for all account him of real part so griev he also in no less measur for young stephen for that he live riotous with those wastrel and murder his good with whore about that present time young stephen fill all cup that stood empti so as there remain but littl mo if the prudent had not shadow their approach from him that still pli it veri busili who pray for the intent of the sovereign pontiff he gave them for a pledg the vicar of christ which also as he said is vicar of bray now drink we quod he of this mazer and quaff ye this mead which is not inde parcel of my bodi but my soul bodiment leav ye fraction of bread to them that live by bread alon be not afeard neither for ani want for this will comfort more than the other will dismay see ye here and he show them glister coin of the tribut and goldsmith note the worth of two pound nineteen shill that he had he said for a song which he writ they all admir to see the foresaid rich in such dearth of money as was herebefor his word were then these as followeth know all men he said time ruin build etern mansion what mean this desir wind blast the thorntre but after it becom from a bramblebush to be a rose upon the rood of time mark me now in woman womb word is made flesh but in the spirit of the maker all flesh that pass becom the word that shall not pass away this is the postcreat omni caro ad te veniet no question but her name is puissant who aventri the dear cors of our agenbuy healer and herd our mighti mother and mother most vener and bernardus saith apt that she hath an omnipotentiam deipara supplicem that is to wit an almighti of petit becaus she is the second eve and she won us saith augustin too wherea that other our grandam which we are link up with by success anastomosi of navelcord sold us all seed breed and generat for a penni pippin but here is the matter now or she knew him that second i say and was but creatur of her creatur vergin madr figlia di tuo figlio or she knew him not and then stand she in the one denial or ignor with peter piscat who live in the hous that jack built and with joseph the joiner patron of the happi demis of all unhappi marriag parcequ m leo taxil nous a dit que qui lavait mise dan cett fichu posit cetait le sacr pigeon ventr de dieu entwed transubstanti oder consubstanti but in no case subsubstanti and all cri out upon it for a veri scurvi word a pregnanc without joy he said a birth without pang a bodi without blemish a belli without big let the lewd with faith and fervour worship with will will we withstand withsay hereupon punch costello ding with his fist upon the board and would sing a bawdi catch staboo stabella about a wench that was put in pod of a jolli swashbuckl in almani which he did straightway now attack the first three month she was not well staboo when here nurs quigley from the door anger bid them hist ye should shame you nor was it not meet as she rememb them be her mind was to have all order against lord andrew came for becaus she was jealous that no gast turmoil might shorten the honour of her guard it was an ancient and a sad matron of a sedat look and christian walk in habit dun beseem her megrim and wrinkl visag nor did her hortat want of it effect for incontin punch costello was of them all embraid and they reclaim the churl with civil rude some and shake him with menac of blandish other while they all chode with him a murrain seiz the dolt what a devil he would be at thou chuff thou puni thou got in peasestraw thou losel thou chitterl thou spawn of a rebel thou dykedropt thou abort thou to shut up his drunken drool out of that like a curs of god ape the good sir leopold that had for his cognis the flower of quiet margerain gentl advis also the time occas as most sacr and most worthi to be most sacr in horn hous rest should reign to be short this passag was scarc by when master dixon of mari in eccl good grin ask young stephen what was the reason whi he had not cide to take friar vow and he answer him obedi in the womb chastiti in the tomb but involuntari poverti all his day master lenehan at this made return that he had heard of those nefari deed and how as he heard hereof count he had besmirch the lili virtu of a confid femal which was corrupt of minor and they all intershow it too wax merri and toast to his fathership but he said veri entir it was clean contrari to their suppos for he was the etern son and ever virgin thereat mirth grew in them the more and they rehears to him his curious rite of wedlock for the disrob and deflow of spous as the priest use in madagascar island she to be in guis of white and saffron her groom in white and grain with burn of nard and taper on a brideb while clerk sung kyri and the anthem ut novetur sexus omni corpori mysterium till she was there unmaid he gave them then a much admir hymen minim by those delic poet master john fletcher and master franci beaumont that is in their maid tragedi that was writ for a like twine of lover to bed to bed was the burden of it to be play with accompan concent upon the virgin an exquisit dulcet epithalam of most mollif suadenc for juvenil amatori whom the odorifer flambeaus of the paranymph have escort to the quadruped proscenium of connubi communion well met they were said master dixon joy but harke young sir better were they name beau mount and lecher for by my troth of such a mingl much might come young stephen said inde to his best remembr they had but the one doxi between them and she of the stew to make shift with in delight amor for life ran veri high in those day and the custom of the countri approv with it greater love than this he said no man hath that a man lay down his wife for his friend go thou and do likewis thus or word to that effect saith zarathustra sometim regius professor of french letter to the univers of oxtail nor breath there ever that man to whom mankind was more beholden bring a stranger within thi tower it will go hard but thou wilt have the secondbest bed orat fratr pro memetipso and all the peopl shall say amen rememb erin thi generat and thi day of old how thou settedst littl by me and by my word and broughtedst in a stranger to my gate to commit fornic in my sight and to wax fat and kick like jeshurum therefor hast thou sin against my light and hast made me thi lord to be the slave of servant return return clan milli forget me not o milesian whi hast thou done this abomin befor me that thou didst spurn me for a merchant of jalap and didst deni me to the roman and to the indian of dark speech with whom thi daughter did lie luxuri look forth now my peopl upon the land of behest even from horeb and from nebo and from pisgah and from the horn of hatten unto a land flow with milk and money but thou hast suckl me with a bitter milk my moon and my sun thou hast quench for ever and thou hast left me alon for ever in the dark way of my bitter and with a kiss of ash hast thou kiss my mouth this tenebros of the interior he proceed to say hath not been illumin by the wit of the septuagint nor so much as mention for the orient from on high which brake hell gate visit a dark that was foran assuefact minor atroc as tulli saith of his darl stoic and hamlet his father showeth the princ no blister of combust the adiaphan in the noon of life is an egypt plagu which in the night of prenat and postmortem is their most proper ubi and quomodo and as the end and ultim of all thing accord in some mean and measur with their incept and origin that same multiplicit concord which lead forth growth from birth accomplish by a retrogress metamorphosi that minish and ablat toward the final which is agreeabl unto natur so is it with our subsolar be the age sister draw us into life we wail batten sport clip clasp sunder dwindl die over us dead they bend first save from water of old nile among bulrush a bed of fasciat wattl at last the caviti of a mountain an occult sepulchr amid the conclam of the hillcat and the ossifrag and as no man know the ubic of his tumulus nor to what process we shall therebi be usher nor whether to tophet or to edenvill in the like way is all hidden when we would backward see from what region of remot the what of our whoness hath fetch his whenc thereto punch costello roar out main etienn chanson but he loud bid them lo wisdom hath built herself a hous this vast majest longstablish vault the crystal palac of the creator all in applepi order a penni for him who find the pea behold the mansion rear by dedal jack see the malt store in mani a refluent sack in the proud cirqu of jackjohn bivouac a black crack of nois in the street here alack bawl back loud on left thor thunder in anger aw the hammerhurl came now the storm that hist his heart and master lynch bade him have a care to flout and witwanton as the god self was anger for his hellprat and paganri and he that had erst challeng to be so doughti wax wan as they might all mark and shrank togeth and his pitch that was befor so haught uplift was now of a sudden quit pluck down and his heart shook within the cage of his breast as he tast the rumour of that storm then did some mock and some jeer and punch costello fell hard again to his yale which master lenehan vow he would do after and he was inde but a word and a blow on ani the least colour but the braggart boaster cri that an old nobodaddi was in his cup it was muchwhat indiffer and he would not lag behind his lead but this was onli to dye his desper as cow he crouch in horn hall he drank inde at one draught to pluck up a heart of ani grace for it thunder long rumbl over all the heaven so that master madden be god certain while knock him on his rib upon that crack of doom and master bloom at the braggart side spoke to him calm word to slumber his great fear advertis how it was no other thing but a hubbub nois that he heard the discharg of fluid from the thunderhead look you have taken place and all of the order of a natur phenomenon but was young boasthard fear vanquish by calmer word no for he had in his bosom a spike name bitter which could not by word be done away and was he then neither calm like the one nor god like the other he was neither as much as he would have like to be either but could he not have endeavour to have found again as in his youth the bottl holi that then he live withal inde no for grace was not there to find that bottl heard he then in that clap the voic of the god bringforth or what calmer said a hubbub of phenomenon heard whi he could not but hear unless he had plug him up the tube understand which he had not done for through that tube he saw that he was in the land of phenomenon where he must for a certain one day die as he was like the rest too a pass show and would he not accept to die like the rest and pass away by no mean would he though he must nor would he make more show accord as men do with wive which phenomenon has command them to do by the book law then wot he nought of that other land which is call believ on me that is the land of promis which behov to the king delight and shall be for ever where there is no death and no birth neither wive nor mother at which all shall come as mani as believ on it yes pious had told him of that land and chast had point him to the way but the reason was that in the way he fell in with a certain whore of an eyepleas exterior whose name she said is bird in the hand and she beguil him wrongway from the true path by her flatteri that she said to him as ho you pretti man turn asid hither and i will show you a brave place and she lay at him so flatter that she had him in her grot which is name two in the bush or by some learn carnal concupisc this was it what all that compani that sat there at common in mans of mother the most lust after and if they met with this whore bird in the hand which was within all foul plagu monster and a wick devil they would strain the last but they would make at her and know her for regard believ on me they said it was nought els but notion and they could conceiv no thought of it for first two in the bush whither she tice them was the veri goodliest grot and in it were four pillow on which were four ticket with these word print on them pickaback and topsyturvi and shamefac and cheek by jowl and second for that foul plagu allpox and the monster they care not for them for preserv had given them a stout shield of oxengut and third that they might take no hurt neither from offspr that was that wick devil by virtu of this same shield which was name killchild so were they all in their blind fanci mr cavil and mr sometim god mr ape swillal mr fals franklin mr dainti dixon young boasthard and mr cautious calmer wherein o wretch compani were ye all deceiv for that was the voic of the god that was in a veri grievous rage that he would present lift his arm up and spill their soul for their abus and their spill done by them contrariwis to his word which forth to bring bren biddeth so thursday sixteenth june patk dignam laid in clay of an apoplexi and after hard drought pleas god rain a bargeman come in by water a fifti mile or thereabout with turf say the seed wont sprout field athirst veri sadcolour and stunk mightili the quag and toft too hard to breath and all the young quick clean consum without sprinkl this long while back as no man rememb to be without the rosi bud all gone brown and spread out blob and on the hill nought but dri flag and faggot that would catch at first fire all the world say for aught they knew the big wind of last februari a year that did havoc the land so piti a small thing besid this barren but by and by as said this even after sundown the wind sit in the west biggish swollen cloud to be seen as the night increas and the weatherwis pore up at them and some sheet lightn at first and after past ten of the clock one great stroke with a long thunder and in a brace of shake all scamper pellmel within door for the smoke shower the men make shelter for their straw with a clout or kerchief womenfolk skip off with kirtl catch up soon as the pour came in eli place baggot street duke lawn thenc through merrion green up to holl street a swash of water flow that was befor bonedri and not one chair or coach or fiacr seen about but no more crack after that first over against the rt hon mr justic fitzgibbon door that is to sit with mr heali the lawyer upon the colleg land mal mulligan a gentleman gentleman that had but come from mr moor the writer that was a papish but is now folk say a good williamit chanc against alec bannon in a cut bob which are now in with danc cloak of kendal green that was new got to town from mullingar with the stage where his coz and mal ms brother will stay a month yet till saint swithin and ask what in the earth he doe there he bound home and he to andrew horn be stay for to crush a cup of wine so he said but would tell him of a skittish heifer big of her age and beef to the heel and all this while pour with rain and so both togeth on to horn there leop bloom of crawford journal sit snug with a covey of wag like brangl fellow dixon jun scholar of my ladi of merci vin lynch a scot fellow will madden t lenehan veri sad about a racer he fanci and stephen d leop bloom there for a languor he had but was now better be have dream tonight a strang fanci of his dame mrs moll with red slipper on in a pair of turkey trunk which is thought by those in ken to be for a chang and mistress purefoy there that got in through plead her belli and now on the stool poor bodi two day past her term the midwiv sore put to it and cant deliv she queasi for a bowl of riceslop that is a shrewd drier up of the insid and her breath veri heavi more than good and should be a bullyboy from the knock they say but god give her soon issu tis her ninth chick to live i hear and ladi day bit off her last chick nail that was then a twelvemonth and with other three all breastf that die written out in a fair hand in the king bibl her hub fifti odd and a methodist but take the sacrament and is to be seen ani fair sabbath with a pair of his boy off bullock harbour dap on the sound with a heavybrak reel or in a punt he has trail for flounder and pollock and catch a fine bag i hear in sum an infinit great fall of rain and all refresh and will much increas the harvest yet those in ken say after wind and water fire shall come for a prognost of malachi almanac and i hear that mr russel has done a prophet charm of the same gist out of the hindustanish for his farmer gazett to have three thing in all but this a mere fetch without bottom of reason for old crone and bairn yet sometim they are found in the right guess with their queeriti no tell how with this came up lenehan to the feet of the tabl to say how the letter was in that night gazett and he made a show to find it about him for he swore with an oath that he had been at pain about it but on stephen persuas he gave over the search and was bidden to sit near by which he did mighti brisk he was a kind of sport gentleman that went for a merryandrew or honest pickl and what belong of women horseflesh or hot scandal he had it pat to tell the truth he was mean in fortun and for the most part hanker about the coffeehous and low tavern with crimp ostler booki paul men runner flatcap waistcoat ladi of the bagnio and other rogu of the game or with a chanceabl catchpol or a tipstaff often at night till broad day of whom he pick up between his sackposset much loos gossip he took his ordinari at a boilingcook and if he had but gotten into him a mess of broken victual or a platter of tripe with a bare tester in his purs he could alway bring himself off with his tongu some randi quip he had from a punk or whatnot that everi mother son of them would burst their side the other costello that is hear this talk ask was it poetri or a tale faith no he say frank that was his name tis all about kerri cow that are to be butcher along of the plagu but they can go hang say he with a wink for me with their bulli beef a pox on it there as good fish in this tin as ever came out of it and veri friend he offer to take of some salti sprat that stood by which he had eye wish in the meantim and found the place which was inde the chief design of his embassi as he was sharpset mort aux vach say frank then in the french languag that had been indentur to a brandyshipp that has a winelodg in bordeaux and he spoke french like a gentleman too from a child this frank had been a donought that his father a headborough who could ill keep him to school to learn his letter and the use of the globe matricul at the univers to studi the mechan but he took the bit between his teeth like a raw colt and was more familiar with the justiciari and the parish beadl than with his volum one time he would be a playactor then a sutler or a welsher then nought would keep him from the bearpit and the cock main then he was for the ocean sea or to hoof it on the road with the romani folk kidnap a squir heir by favour of moonlight or feck maid linen or choke chicken behind a hedg he had been off as mani time as a cat has live and back again with nake pocket as mani more to his father the headborough who shed a pint of tear as often as he saw him what say mr leopold with his hand across that was earnest to know the drift of it will they slaughter all i protest i saw them but this day morn go to the liverpool boat say he i can scarc believ tis so bad say he and he had experi of the like brood beast and of springer greasi hogget and wether wool have been some year befor actuari for mr joseph cuff a worthi salesmast that drove his trade for live stock and meadow auction hard by mr gavin low yard in prussia street i question with you there say he more like tis the hoos or the timber tongu mr stephen a littl move but veri handsom told him no such matter and that he had dispatch from the emperor chief tailtickl thank him for the hospit that was send over doctor rinderpest the bestquot cowcatch in all muscovi with a bolus or two of physic to take the bull by the horn come come say mr vincent plain deal hell find himself on the horn of a dilemma if he meddl with a bull that irish say he irish by name and irish by natur say mr stephen and he sent the ale purl about an irish bull in an english chinashop i conceiv you say mr dixon it is that same bull that was sent to our island by farmer nichola the bravest cattlebreed of them all with an emerald ring in his nose true for you say mr vincent cross the tabl and a bullsey into the bargain say he and a plumper and a portlier bull say he never shit on shamrock he had horn galor a coat of cloth of gold and a sweet smoki breath come out of his nostril so that the women of our island leav doughbal and rollingpin follow after him hang his bulli in daisychain what for that say mr dixon but befor he came over farmer nichola that was a eunuch had him proper geld by a colleg of doctor who were no better off than himself so be off now say he and do all my cousin german the lord harri tell you and take a farmer bless and with that he slap his posterior veri sound but the slap and the bless stood him friend say mr vincent for to make up he taught him a trick worth two of the other so that maid wife abbess and widow to this day affirm that they would rather ani time of the month whisper in his ear in the dark of a cowhous or get a lick on the nape from his long holi tongu than lie with the finest strap young ravish in the four field of all ireland anoth then put in his word and they dress him say he in a point shift and petticoat with a tippet and girdl and ruffl on his wrist and clip his forelock and rub him all over with spermacet oil and built stabl for him at everi turn of the road with a gold manger in each full of the best hay in the market so that he could doss and dung to his heart content by this time the father of the faith for so they call him was grown so heavi that he could scarc walk to pastur to remedi which our cozen dame and damsel brought him his fodder in their apronlap and as soon as his belli was full he would rear up on his hind uarter to show their ladyship a mysteri and roar and bellow out of him in bull languag and they all after him ay say anoth and so pamper was he that he would suffer nought to grow in all the land but green grass for himself for that was the onli colour to his mind and there was a board put up on a hillock in the middl of the island with a print notic say by the lord harri green is the grass that grow on the ground and say mr dixon if ever he got scent of a cattleraid in roscommon or the wild of connemara or a husbandman in sligo that was sow as much as a hand of mustard or a bag of rapese out hed run amok over half the countrysid root up with his horn whatev was plant and all by lord harri order there was bad blood between them at first say mr vincent and the lord harri call farmer nichola all the old nick in the world and an old whoremast that kept seven trull in his hous and ill meddl in his matter say he ill make that anim smell hell say he with the help of that good pizzl my father left me but one even say mr dixon when the lord harri was clean his royal pelt to go to dinner after win a boatrac he had spade oar for himself but the first rule of the cours was that the other were to row with pitchfork he discov in himself a wonder like to a bull and on pick up a blackthumb chapbook that he kept in the pantri he found sure enough that he was a lefthand descend of the famous champion bull of the roman bos bovum which is good bog latin for boss of the show after that say mr vincent the lord harri put his head into a cow drinkingtrough in the presenc of all his courtier and pull it out again told them all his new name then with the water run off him he got into an old smock and skirt that had belong to his grandmoth and bought a grammar of the bull languag to studi but he could never learn a word of it except the first person pronoun which he copi out big and got off by heart and if ever he went out for a walk he fill his pocket with chalk to write it upon what took his fanci the side of a rock or a teahous tabl or a bale of cotton or a corkfloat in short he and the bull of ireland were soon as fast friend as an ars and a shirt they were say mr stephen and the end was that the men of the island see no help was toward as the ungrat women were all of one mind made a wherri raft load themselv and their bundl of chattel on shipboard set all mast erect man the yard sprang their luff heav to spread three sheet in the wind put her head between wind and water weigh anchor port her helm ran up the jolli roger gave three time three let the bullgin run push off in their bumboat and put to sea to recov the main of america which was the occas say mr vincent of the compos by a boatswain of that rollick chanti pope peter but a pissab a man a man for a that our worthi acquaint mr malachi mulligan now appear in the doorway as the student were finish their apologu accompani with a friend whom he had just rencount a young gentleman his name alec bannon who had late come to town it be his intent to buy a colour or a cornetci in the fencibl and list for the war mr mulligan was civil enough to express some relish of it all the more as it jump with a project of his own for the cure of the veri evil that had been touch on whereat he hand round to the compani a set of pasteboard card which he had had print that day at mr quinnel bear a legend print in fair ital mr malachi mulligan fertilis and incub lambay island his project as he went on to expound was to withdraw from the round of idl pleasur such as form the chief busi of sir fopl popinjay and sir milksop quidnunc in town and to devot himself to the noblest task for which our bodili organ has been frame well let us hear of it good my friend said mr dixon i make no doubt it smack of wench come be seat both tis as cheap sit as stand mr mulligan accept of the invit and expati upon his design told his hearer that he had been led into this thought by a consider of the caus of steril both the inhibitori and the prohibitori whether the inhibit in it turn were due to conjug vexat or to a parsimoni of the balanc as well as whether the prohibit proceed from defect congenit or from procliv acquir it griev him plaguili he said to see the nuptial couch defraud of it dearest pledg and to reflect upon so mani agreeabl femal with rich jointur a prey to the vilest bonz who hide their flambeau under a bushel in an uncongeni cloister or lose their woman bloom in the embrac of some unaccount muskin when they might multipli the inlet of happi sacrif the inestim jewel of their sex when a hundr pretti fellow were at hand to caress this he assur them made his heart weep to curb this inconveni which he conclud due to a suppress of latent heat have advis with certain counsellor of worth and inspect into this matter he had resolv to purchas in fee simpl for ever the freehold of lambay island from it holder lord talbot de malahid a tori gentleman of note much in favour with our ascend parti he propos to set up there a nation fertilis farm to be name omphalo with an obelisk hewn and erect after the fashion of egypt and to offer his duti yeoman servic for the fecund of ani femal of what grade of life soever who should there direct to him with the desir of fulfil the function of her natur money was no object he said nor would he take a penni for his pain the poorest kitchenwench no less than the opul ladi of fashion if so be their construct and their temper were warm persuad for their petit would find in him their man for his nutriment he shew how he would feed himself exclus upon a diet of savouri tubercl and fish and coney there the flesh of these latter prolif rodent be high recommend for his purpos both broil and stew with a blade of mace and a pod or two of capsicum chilli after this homili which he deliv with much warmth of assever mr mulligan in a trice put off from his hat a kerchief with which he had shield it they both it seem had been overtaken by the rain and for all their mend their pace had taken water as might be observ by mr mulligan smallcloth of a hodden grey which was now somewhat piebald his project meanwhil was veri favour entertain by his auditor and won hearti eulog from all though mr dixon of mari except to it ask with a finick air did he purpos also to carri coal to newcastl mr mulligan howev made court to the scholar by an apt quotat from the classic which as it dwelt upon his memori seem to him a sound and tast support of his content tali ac tanta depravatio hujus seculi o quirit ut matresfamiliarum nostra lasciva cujuslibet semiviri libici titillation testibus ponderosi atqu excelsi erectionibus centurionum romanorum magnoper anteponunt while for those of ruder wit he drove home his point by analog of the anim kingdom more suitabl to their stomach the buck and doe of will he be whom so amiabl a creatur will bless with her favour a sigh of affect gave eloqu to these word and have replac the locket in his bosom he wipe his eye and sigh again benefic dissemin of bless to all thi creatur how great and univers must be that sweetest of thi tyranni which can hold in thrall the free and the bond the simpl swain and the polish coxcomb the lover in the heyday of reckless passion and the husband of matur year but inde sir i wander from the point how mingl and imperfect are all our sublunari joy maled he exclaim in anguish would to god that foresight had but she would danc in a delug befor ever she would starv in such an ark of salvat for as she remind me blush piquant and whisper in my ear though there was none to snap her word but giddi butterfli dame strike me silli said costello a low fellow who was fuddl a monstrous fine bit of cowflesh ill be sworn she has rendezv you what you dog have you a way with them gad bud immens so said mr lynch the eye on her the young surgeon howev rose and beg the compani to excus his retreat as the nurs had just then inform him that he was need in the ward merci provid had been pleas to put a period to the suffer of the ladi who was enceint which she had born with a laudabl fortitud and she had given birth to a bounc boy i want patienc said he with those who without wit to enliven or learn to instruct revil an ennobl profess which save the rever due to the deiti is the greatest power for happi upon the earth i am posit when i say that if need were i could produc a cloud of wit to the excel of her nobl exercit which so far from be a byword should be a glorious incent in the human breast i cannot away with them what malign such an one the amiabl miss callan who is the lustr of her own sex and the astonish of our and at an instant the most moment that can befal a puni child of clay perish the thought i shudder to think of the futur of a race where the seed of such malic have been sown and where no right rever is render to mother and maid in hous of horn have deliv himself of this rebuk he salut those present on the by and repair to the door a murmur of approv aros from all and some were for eject the low soaker without more ado a design which would have been effect nor would he have receiv more than his bare desert had he not abridg his transgress by affirm with a horrid imprec for he swore a round hand that he was as good a son of the true fold as ever drew breath stap my vital said he them was alway the sentiment of honest frank costello which i was bred up most particular to honour thi father and thi mother that had the best hand to a rolypoli or a hasti pud as you ever see what i alway look back on with a love heart to revert to mr bloom who after his first entri had been conscious of some impud mock which he howev had born with as be the fruit of that age upon which it is common charg that it know not piti the young spark it is true were as full of extravag as overgrown children the word of their tumultuari discuss were difficult understood and not often nice their testi and outrag mot were such that his intellect resil from nor were they scrupul sensibl of the proprieti though their fund of strong anim spirit spoke in their behalf but the word of mr costello was an unwelcom languag for him for he nauseat the wretch that seem to him a cropear creatur of a misshapen gibbos born out of wedlock and thrust like a crookback tooth and feet first into the world which the dint of the surgeon plier in his skull lent inde a colour to so as to put him in thought of that miss link of creation chain desider by the late ingeni mr darwin it was now for more than the middl span of our allot year that he had pass through the thousand vicissitud of exist and be of a wari ascend and self a man of rare forecast he had enjoin his heart to repress all motion of a rise choler and by intercept them with the readiest precaut foster within his breast that plenitud of suffer which base mind jeer at rash judger scorn and all find toler and but toler to those who creat themselv wit at the cost of feminin delicaci a habit of mind which he never did hold with to them he would conced neither to bear the name nor to herit the tradit of a proper breed while for such that have lost all forbear can lose no more there remain the sharp antidot of experi to caus their insol to beat a precipit and inglori retreat not but what he could feel with mettlesom youth which care nought for the mow of dotard or the gruntl of the sever is ever as the chast fanci of travel with sinbad the sailor and tinbad the tailor and jinbad the jailer and whinbad the whaler and ninbad the nailer and finbad the failer and binbad the bailer and pinbad the pailer and minbad the mailer and hinbad the hailer and rinbad the railer and dinbad the kailer and vinbad the quailer and linbad the yailer and xinbad the phthailer when go to dark bed there was a squar round sinbad the sailor roc auk egg in the night of the bed of all the auk of the roc of darkinbad the brightdayl where yes becaus he never did a thing like that befor as ask to get his breakfast in bed with a coupl of egg sinc the citi arm hotel when he use to be pretend to be laid up with a sick voic do his high to make himself interest for that old faggot mrs riordan that he thought he had a great leg of and she never left us a farth all for mass for herself and her soul greatest miser ever was actual afraid to lay out 4d for her methyl spirit tell me all her ailment she had too much old chat in her about polit and earthquak and the end of the world let us have a bit of fun first god help the world if all the women were her sort down on bathingsuit and lowneck of cours nobodi want her to wear them i suppos she was pious becaus no man would look at her twice i hope ill never be like her a wonder she didnt want us to cover our face but she was a welleduc woman certain and her gabbi talk about mr riordan here and mr riordan there i suppos he was glad to get shut of her and her dog smell my fur and alway edg to get up under my petticoat especi then still i like that in him polit to old women like that and waiter and beggar too hes not proud out of noth but not alway if ever he got anyth realli serious the matter with him it much better for them to go into a hospit where everyth is clean but i suppos id have to dring it into him for a month yes and then wed have a hospit nurs next thing on the carpet have him stay there till they throw him out or a nun mayb like the smutti photo he has shes as much a nun as im not yes becaus theyr so weak and pule when theyr sick they want a woman to get well if his nose bleed youd think it was o tragic and that dyinglook one off the south circular when he sprain his foot at the choir parti at the sugarloaf mountain the day i wore that dress miss stack bring him flower the worst old one she could find at the bottom of the basket anyth at all to get into a man bedroom with her old maid voic tri to imagin he was die on account of her to never see thi face again though he look more like a man with his beard a bit grown in the bed father was the same besid i hate bandag and dose when he cut his toe with the razor pare his corn afraid hed get bloodpoison but if it was a thing i was sick then wed see what attent onli of cours the woman hide it not to give all the troubl they do yes he came somewher im sure by his appetit anyway love it not or hed be off his feed think of her so either it was one of those night women if it was down there he was realli and the hotel stori he made up a pack of lie to hide it plan it hyne kept me who did i meet ah yes i met do you rememb menton and who els who let me see that big babbyfac i saw him and he not long marri flirt with a young girl at pool myriorama and turn my back on him when he slink out look quit conscious what harm but he had the impud to make up to me one time well done to him mouth almighti and his boil eye of all the big stupo i ever met and that call a solicitor onli for i hate have a long wrangl in bed or els if it not that it some littl bitch or other he got in with somewher or pick up on the sli if they onli knew him as well as i do yes becaus the day befor yesterday he was scribbl someth a letter when i came into the front room to show him dignam death in the paper as if someth told me and he cover it up with the blottingpap pretend to be think about busi so veri probabl that was it to somebodi who think she has a softi in him becaus all men get a bit like that at his age especi get on to forti he is now so as to wheedl ani money she can out of him no fool like an old fool and then the usual kiss my bottom was to hide it not that i care two straw now who he doe it with or knew befor that way though id like to find out so long as i dont have the two of them under my nose all the time like that slut that mari we had in ontario terrac pad out her fals bottom to excit him bad enough to get the smell of those paint women off him onc or twice i had a suspicion by get him to come near me when i found the long hair on his coat without that one when i went into the kitchen pretend he was drink water 1 woman is not enough for them it was all his fault of cours ruin servant then propos that she could eat at our tabl on christma day if you pleas o no thank you not in my hous steal my potato and the oyster 2/6 per doz go out to see her aunt if you pleas common robberi so it was but i was sure he had someth on with that one it take me to find out a thing like that he said you have no proof it was her proof o yes her aunt was veri fond of oyster but i told her what i thought of her suggest me to go out to be alon with her i wouldnt lower myself to spi on them the garter i found in her room the friday she was out that was enough for me a littl bit too much her face swell up on her with temper when i gave her her week notic i saw to that better do without them altogeth do out the room myself quicker onli for the damn cook and throw out the dirt i gave it to him anyhow either she or me leav the hous i couldnt even touch him if i thought he was with a dirti barefac liar and sloven like that one deni it up to my face and sing about the place in the w c too becaus she knew she was too well off yes becaus he couldnt possibl do without it that long so he must do it somewher and the last time he came on my bottom when was it the night boylan gave my hand a great squeez go along by the tolka in my hand there steal anoth i just press the back of his like that with my thumb to squeez back sing the young may moon shes beam love becaus he has an idea about him and me hes not such a fool he said im dine out and go to the gaieti though im not go to give him the satisfact in ani case god know hes a chang in a way not to be alway and ever wear the same old hat unless i paid some nicelook boy to do it sinc i cant do it myself a young boy would like me id confus him a littl alon with him if we were id let him see my garter the new one and make him turn red look at him seduc him i know what boy feel with that down on their cheek do that frig draw out the thing by the hour question and answer would you do this that and the other with the coalman yes with a bishop yes i would becaus i told him about some dean or bishop was sit besid me in the jew templ garden when i was knit that woollen thing a stranger to dublin what place was it and so on about the monument and he tire me out with statu encourag him make him wors than he is who is in your mind now tell me who are you think of who is it tell me his name who tell me who the german emperor is it yes imagin im him think of him can you feel him tri to make a whore of me what he never will he ought to give it up now at this age of his life simpli ruinat for ani woman and no satisfact in it pretend to like it till he come and then finish it off myself anyway and it make your lip pale anyhow it done now onc and for all with all the talk of the world about it peopl make it onli the first time after that it just the ordinari do it and think no more about it whi cant you kiss a man without go and marri him first you sometim love to wild when you feel that way so nice all over you you cant help yourself i wish some man or other would take me sometim when hes there and kiss me in his arm there noth like a kiss long and hot down to your soul almost paralys you then i hate that confess when i use to go to father corrigan he touch me father and what harm if he did where and i said on the canal bank like a fool but whereabout on your person my child on the leg behind high up was it yes rather high up was it where you sit down yes o lord couldnt he say bottom right out and have done with it what has that got to do with it and did you whatev way he put it i forget no father and i alway think of the real father what did he want to know for when i alreadi confess it to god he had a nice fat hand the palm moist alway i wouldnt mind feel it neither would he id say by the bullneck in his horsecollar i wonder did he know me in the box i could see his face he couldnt see mine of cours hed never turn or let on still his eye were red when his father die theyr lost for a woman of cours must be terribl when a man cri let alon them id like to be embrac by one in his vestment and the smell of incens off him like the pope besid there no danger with a priest if your marri hes too care about himself then give someth to h h the pope for a penanc i wonder was he satisfi with me one thing i didnt like his slap me behind go away so familiar in the hall though i laugh im not a hors or an ass am i i suppos he was think of his father i wonder is he awak think of me or dream am i in it who gave him that flower he said he bought he smelt of some kind of drink not whiski or stout or perhap the sweeti kind of past they stick their bill up with some liqueur id like to sip those richlook green and yellow expens drink those stagedoor johnni drink with the opera hat i tast onc with my finger dip out of that american that had the squirrel talk stamp with father he had all he could do to keep himself from fall asleep after the last time after we took the port and pot meat it had a fine salti tast yes becaus i felt love and tire myself and fell asleep as sound as a top the moment i pop straight into bed till that thunder woke me up god be merci to us i thought the heaven were come down about us to punish us when i bless myself and said a hail mari like those aw thunderbolt in gibraltar as if the world was come to an end and then they come and tell you there no god what could you do if it was run and rush about noth onli make an act of contrit the candl i lit that even in whitefriar street chapel for the month of may see it brought it luck though hed scoff if he heard becaus he never goe to church mass or meet he say your soul you have no soul insid onli grey matter becaus he doesnt know what it is to have one yes when i lit the lamp becaus he must have come 3 or 4 time with that tremend big red brute of a thing he has i thought the vein or whatev the dicken they call it was go to burst though his nose is not so big after i took off all my thing with the blind down after my hour dress and perfum and comb it like iron or some kind of a thick crowbar stand all the time he must have eaten oyster i think a few dozen he was in great sing voic no i never in all my life felt anyon had one the size of that to make you feel full up he must have eaten a whole sheep after what the idea make us like that with a big hole in the middl of us or like a stallion drive it up into you becaus that all they want out of you with that determin vicious look in his eye i had to halfshut my eye still he hasnt such a tremend amount of spunk in him when i made him pull out and do it on me consid how big it is so much the better in case ani of it wasnt wash out proper the last time i let him finish it in me nice invent they made for women for him to get all the pleasur but if someon gave them a touch of it themselv theyd know what i went through with milli nobodi would believ cut her teeth too and mina purefoy husband give us a swing out of your whisker fill her up with a child or twin onc a year as regular as the clock alway with a smell of children off her the one they call budger or someth like a nigger with a shock of hair on it jesusjack the child is a black the last time i was there a squad of them fall over one anoth and bawl you couldnt hear your ear suppos to be healthi not satisfi till they have us swollen out like eleph or i dont know what suppos i risk have anoth not off him though still if he was marri im sure hed have a fine strong child but i dont know poldi has more spunk in him yes thatd be aw jolli i suppos it was meet josi powel and the funer and think about me and boylan set him off well he can think what he like now if thatll do him ani good i know they were spoon a bit when i came on the scene he was danc and sit out with her the night of georgina simpson housewarm and then he want to ram it down my neck it was on account of not like to see her a wallflow that was whi we had the standup row over polit he began it not me when he said about our lord be a carpent at last he made me cri of cours a woman is so sensit about everyth i was fume with myself after for give in onli for i knew he was gone on me and the first socialist he said he was he annoy me so much i couldnt put him into a temper still he know a lot of mixedup thing especi about the bodi and the insid i often want to studi up that myself what we have insid us in that famili physician i could alway hear his voic talk when the room was crowd and watch him after that i pretend i had a cool on with her over him becaus he use to be a bit on the jealous side whenev he ask who are you go to and i said over to floey and he made me the present of byron poem and the three pair of glove so that finish that i could quit easili get him to make it up ani time i know how id even suppos he got in with her again and was go out to see her somewher id know if he refus to eat the onion i know plenti of way ask him to tuck down the collar of my blous or touch him with my veil and glove on go out i kiss then would send them all spin howev alright well see then let him go to her she of cours would onli be too delight to pretend shes mad in love with him that i wouldnt so much mind id just go to her and ask her do you love him and look her squar in the eye she couldnt fool me but he might imagin he was and make a declar to her with his plabberi kind of a manner like he did to me though i had the devil own job to get it out of him though i like him for that it show he could hold in and wasnt to be got for the ask he was on the pop of ask me too the night in the kitchen i was roll the potato cake there someth i want to say to you onli for i put him off let on i was in a temper with my hand and arm full of pasti flour in ani case i let out too much the night befor talk of dream so i didnt want to let him know more than was good for him she use to be alway embrac me josi whenev he was there mean him of cours glaum me over and when i said i wash up and down as far as possibl ask me and did you wash possibl the women are alway eg on to that put it on thick when hes there they know by his sli eye blink a bit put on the indiffer when they come out with someth the kind he is what spoil him i dont wonder in the least becaus he was veri handsom at that time tri to look like lord byron i said i like though he was too beauti for a man and he was a littl befor we got engag afterward though she didnt like it so much the day i was in fit of laugh with the giggl i couldnt stop about all my hairpin fall out one after anoth with the mass of hair i had your alway in great humour she said yes becaus it grig her becaus she knew what it meant becaus i use to tell her a good bit of what went on between us not all but just enough to make her mouth water but that wasnt my fault she didnt darken the door much after we were marri i wonder what shes got like now after live with that dotti husband of her she had her face begin to look drawn and run down the last time i saw her she must have been just after a row with him becaus i saw on the moment she was edg to draw down a convers about husband and talk about him to run him down what was it she told me o yes that sometim he use to go to bed with his muddi boot on when the maggot take him just imagin have to get into bed with a thing like that that might murder you ani moment what a man well it not the one way everyon goe mad poldi anyhow whatev he doe alway wipe his feet on the mat when he come in wet or shine and alway black his own boot too and he alway take off his hat when he come up in the street like then and now hes go about in his slipper to look for 10000 pound for a postcard u p up o sweetheart may wouldnt a thing like that simpli bore you stiff to extinct actual too stupid even to take his boot off now what could you make of a man like that id rather die 20 time over than marri anoth of their sex of cours hed never find anoth woman like me to put up with him the way i do know me come sleep with me yes and he know that too at the bottom of his heart take that mrs maybrick that poison her husband for what i wonder in love with some other man yes it was found out on her wasnt she the downright villain to go and do a thing like that of cours some men can be dread aggrav drive you mad and alway the worst word in the world what do they ask us to marri them for if were so bad as all that come to yes becaus they cant get on without us white arsenic she put in his tea off flypap wasnt it i wonder whi they call it that if i ask him hed say it from the greek leav us as wise as we were befor she must have been mad in love with the other fellow to run the chanc of be hang o she didnt care if that was her natur what could she do besid theyr not brute enough to go and hang a woman sure are they theyr all so differ boylan talk about the shape of my foot he notic at onc even befor he was introduc when i was in the d b c with poldi laugh and tri to listen i was waggl my foot we both order 2 tea and plain bread and butter i saw him look with his two old maid of sister when i stood up and ask the girl where it was what do i care with it drop out of me and that black close breech he made me buy take you half an hour to let them down wet all myself alway with some brandnew fad everi other week such a long one i did i forgot my sued glove on the seat behind that i never got after some robber of a woman and he want me to put it in the irish time lost in the ladi lavatori d b c dame street finder return to mrs marion bloom and i saw his eye on my feet go out through the turn door he was look when i look back and i went there for tea 2 day after in the hope but he wasnt now how did that excit him becaus i was cross them when we were in the other room first he meant the shoe that are too tight to walk in my hand is nice like that if i onli had a ring with the stone for my month a nice aquamarin ill stick him for one and a gold bracelet i dont like my foot so much still i made him spend onc with my foot the night after goodwin botchup of a concert so cold and windi it was well we had that rum in the hous to mull and the fire wasnt black out when he ask to take off my stock lie on the hearthrug in lombard street west and anoth time it was my muddi boot hed like me to walk in all the hors dung i could find but of cours hes not natur like the rest of the world that i what did he say i could give 9 point in 10 to katti lanner and beat her what doe that mean i ask him i forget what he said becaus the stoppress edit just pass and the man with the cur hair in the lucan dairi that so polit i think i saw his face befor somewher i notic him when i was tast the butter so i took my time bartel darci too that he use to make fun of when he commenc kiss me on the choir stair after i sang gounod ave maria what are we wait for o my heart kiss me straight on the brow and part which is my brown part he was pretti hot for all his tinni voic too my low note he was alway rave about if you can believ him i like the way he use his mouth sing then he said wasnt it terribl to do that there in a place like that i dont see anyth so terribl about it ill tell him about that some day not now and surpris him ay and ill take him there and show him the veri place too we did it so now there you are like it or lump it he think noth can happen without him know he hadnt an idea about my mother till we were engag otherwis hed never have got me so cheap as he did he was lo time wors himself anyhow beg me to give him a tini bit cut off my drawer that was the even come along kenilworth squar he kiss me in the eye of my glove and i had to take it off ask me question is it permit to enquir the shape of my bedroom so i let him keep it as if i forgot it to think of me when i saw him slip it into his pocket of cours hes mad on the subject of drawer that plain to be seen alway skeez at those brazenfac thing on the bicycl with their skirt blow up to their navel even when milli and i were out with him at the open air fete that one in the cream muslin stand right against the sun so he could see everi atom she had on when he saw me from behind follow in the rain i saw him befor he saw me howev stand at the corner of the harold cross road with a new raincoat on him with the muffler in the zingari colour to show off his complexion and the brown hat look slyboot as usual what was he do there where hed no busi they can go and get whatev they like from anyth at all with a skirt on it and were not to ask ani question but they want to know where were you where are you go i could feel him come along skulk after me his eye on my neck he had been keep away from the hous he felt it was get too warm for him so i halfturn and stop then he pester me to say yes till i took off my glove slowli watch him he said my openwork sleev were too cold for the rain anyth for an excus to put his hand anear me drawer drawer the whole bless time till i promis to give him the pair off my doll to carri about in his waistcoat pocket o maria santisima he did look a big fool dreep in the rain splendid set of teeth he had made me hungri to look at them and beseech of me to lift the orang petticoat i had on with the sunray pleat that there was nobodi he said hed kneel down in the wet if i didnt so persev he would too and ruin his new raincoat you never know what freak theyd take alon with you theyr so savag for it if anyon was pass so i lift them a bit and touch his trouser outsid the way i use to gardner after with my ring hand to keep him from do wors where it was too public i was die to find out was he circumcis he was shake like a jelli all over they want to do everyth too quick take all the pleasur out of it and father wait all the time for his dinner he told me to say i left my purs in the butcher and had to go back for it what a deceiv then he wrote me that letter with all those word in it how could he have the face to ani woman after his compani manner make it so awkward after when we met ask me have i offend you with my eyelid down of cours he saw i wasnt he had a few brain not like that other fool henni doyl he was alway break or tear someth in the charad i hate an unlucki man and if i knew what it meant of cours i had to say no for form sake dont understand you i said and wasnt it natur so it is of cours it use to be written up with a pictur of a woman on that wall in gibraltar with that word i couldnt find anywher onli for children see it too young then write everi morn a letter sometim twice a day i like the way he made love then he knew the way to take a
