woman when he sent me the 8 big poppi becaus mine was the 8th then i wrote the night he kiss my heart at dolphin barn i couldnt describ it simpli it make you feel like noth on earth but he never knew how to embrac well like gardner i hope hell come on monday as he said at the same time four i hate peopl who come at all hour answer the door you think it the veget then it somebodi and you all undress or the door of the filthi sloppi kitchen blow open the day old frostyfac goodwin call about the concert in lombard street and i just after dinner all flush and toss with boil old stew dont look at me professor i had to say im a fright yes but he was a real old gent in his way it was imposs to be more respect nobodi to say your out you have to peep out through the blind like the messengerboy today i thought it was a putoff first him send the port and the peach first and i was just begin to yawn with nerv think he was tri to make a fool of me when i knew his tattarrattat at the door he must have been a bit late becaus it was l/4 after 3 when i saw the 2 dedalus girl come from school i never know the time even that watch he gave me never seem to go proper id want to get it look after when i threw the penni to that lame sailor for england home and beauti when i was whistl there is a charm girl i love and i hadnt even put on my clean shift or powder myself or a thing then this day week were to go to belfast just as well he has to go to enni his father anniversari the 27th it wouldnt be pleasant if he did suppos our room at the hotel were besid each other and ani fool went on in the new bed i couldnt tell him to stop and not bother me with him in the next room or perhap some protest clergyman with a cough knock on the wall then hed never believ the next day we didnt do someth it all veri well a husband but you cant fool a lover after me tell him we never did anyth of cours he didnt believ me no it better hes go where he is besid someth alway happen with him the time go to the mallow concert at maryborough order boil soup for the two of us then the bell rang out he walk down the platform with the soup splash about take spoon of it hadnt he the nerv and the waiter after him make a holi show of us screech and confus for the engin to start but he wouldnt pay till he finish it the two gentlemen in the 3rd class carriag said he was quit right so he was too hes so pighead sometim when he get a thing into his head a good job he was abl to open the carriag door with his knife or theyd have taken us on to cork i suppos that was done out of reveng on him o i love jaunt in a train or a car with love soft cushion i wonder will he take a 1st class for me he might want to do it in the train by tip the guard well o i suppos therel be the usual idiot of men gape at us with their eye as stupid as ever they can possibl be that was an except man that common workman that left us alon in the carriag that day go to howth id like to find out someth about him l or 2 tunnel perhap then you have to look out of the window all the nicer then come back suppos i never came back what would they say elop with him that get you on on the stage the last concert i sang at where it over a year ago when was it st teresa hall clarendon st littl chit of missi they have now sing kathleen kearney and her like on account of father be in the armi and my sing the absentmind beggar and wear a brooch for lord robert when i had the map of it all and poldi not irish enough was it him manag it this time i wouldnt put it past him like he got me on to sing in the stabat mater by go around say he was put lead kind light to music i put him up to that till the jesuit found out he was a freemason thump the piano lead thou me on copi from some old opera yes and he was go about with some of them sinner fein late or whatev they call themselv talk his usual trash and nonsens he say that littl man he show me without the neck is veri intellig the come man griffith is he well he doesnt look it that all i can say still it must have been him he knew there was a boycott i hate the mention of their polit after the war that pretoria and ladysmith and bloemfontein where gardner lieut stanley g 8th bn 2nd east lanc rgt of enter fever he was a love fellow in khaki and just the right height over me im sure he was brave too he said i was love the even we kiss goodby at the canal lock my irish beauti he was pale with excit about go away or wed be seen from the road he couldnt stand proper and i so hot as i never felt they could have made their peac in the begin or old oom paul and the rest of the other old kruger go and fight it out between them instead of drag on for year kill ani finelook men there were with their fever if he was even decent shot it wouldnt have been so bad i love to see a regiment pass in review the first time i saw the spanish cavalri at la roqu it was love after look across the bay from algecira all the light of the rock like firefli or those sham battl on the 15 acr the black watch with their kilt in time at the march past the 10th hussar the princ of wale own or the lancer o the lancer theyr grand or the dublin that won tugela his father made his money over sell the hors for the cavalri well he could buy me a nice present up in belfast after what i gave him theyv love linen up there or one of those nice kimono thing i must buy a mothbal like i had befor to keep in the drawer with them it would be excit go round with him shop buy those thing in a new citi better leav this ring behind want to keep turn and turn to get it over the knuckl there or they might bell it round the town in their paper or tell the polic on me but theyd think were marri o let them all go and smother themselv for the fat lot i care he has plenti of money and hes not a marri man so somebodi better get it out of him if i could find out whether he like me i look a bit washi of cours when i look close in the handglass powder a mirror never give you the express besid scrooch down on me like that all the time with his big hipbon hes heavi too with his hairi chest for this heat alway have to lie down for them better for him put it into me from behind the way mrs mastianski told me her husband made her like the dog do it and stick out her tongu as far as ever she could and he so quiet and mild with his tingat cither can you ever be up to men the way it take them love stuff in that blue suit he had on and stylish tie and sock with the skyblu silk thing on them hes certain well off i know by the cut his cloth have and his heavi watch but he was like a perfect devil for a few minut after he came back with the stoppress tear up the ticket and swear blaze becaus he lost 20 quid he said he lost over that outsid that won and half he put on for me on account of lenehan tip curs him to the lowest pit that sponger he was make free with me after the glencre dinner come back that long joult over the featherb mountain after the lord mayor look at me with his dirti eye val dillon that big heathen i first notic him at dessert when i was crack the nut with my teeth i wish i could have pick everi morsel of that chicken out of my finger it was so tasti and brown and as tender as anyth onli for i didnt want to eat everyth on my plate those fork and fishslic were hallmark silver too i wish i had some i could easili have slip a coupl into my muff when i was play with them then alway hang out of them for money in a restaur for the bit you put down your throat we have to be thank for our mangi cup of tea itself as a great compliment to be notic the way the world is divid in ani case if it go to go on i want at least two other good chemis for one thing and but i dont know what kind of drawer he like none at all i think didnt he say yes and half the girl in gibraltar never wore them either nake as god made them that andalusian sing her manola she didnt make much secret of what she hadnt yes and the second pair of silkett stock is ladder after one day wear i could have brought them back to lewer this morn and kick up a row and made that one chang them onli not to upset myself and run the risk of walk into him and ruin the whole thing and one of those kidfit corset id want advertis cheap in the gentlewoman with elast gore on the hip he save the one i have but that no good what did they say they give a delight figur line 11/6 obviat that unsight broad appear across the lower back to reduc flesh my belli is a bit too big ill have to knock off the stout at dinner or am i get too fond of it the last they sent from orourk was as flat as a pancak he make his money easi larri they call him the old mangi parcel he sent at xmas a cottag cake and a bottl of hogwash he tri to palm off as claret that he couldnt get anyon to drink god spare his spit for fear hed die of the drouth or i must do a few breath exercis i wonder is that antifat ani good might overdo it the thin one are not so much the fashion now garter that much i have the violet pair i wore today that all he bought me out of the chequ he got on the first o no there was the face lotion i finish the last of yesterday that made my skin like new i told him over and over again get that made up in the same place and dont forget it god onli know whether he did after all i said to him 111 know by the bottl anyway if not i suppos 111 onli have to wash in my piss like beeftea or chickensoup with some of that opoponax and violet i thought it was begin to look coars or old a bit the skin underneath is much finer where it peel off there on my finger after the burn it a piti it isnt all like that and the four paltri handkerchief about 6/ in all sure you cant get on in this world without style all go in food and rent when i get it ill lash it around i tell you in fine style i alway want to throw a hand of tea into the pot measur and minc if i buy a pair of old brogu itself do you like those new shoe yes how much were they ive no cloth at all the brown costum and the skirt and jacket and the one at the cleaner 3 what that for ani woman cut up this old hat and patch up the other the men wont look at you and women tri to walk on you becaus they know youv no man then with all the thing get dearer everi day for the 4 year more i have of life up to 35 no im what am i at all 111 be 33 in septemb will i what o well look at that mrs galbraith shes much older than me i saw her when i was out last week her beauti on the wane she was a love woman magnific head of hair on her down to her waist toss it back like that like kitti oshea in grantham street 1st thing i did everi morn to look across see her comb it as if she love it and was full of it piti i onli got to know her the day befor we left and that mrs langtri the jersey lili the princ of wale was in love with i suppos hes like the first man go the road onli for the name of a king theyr all made the one way onli a black man id like to tri a beauti up to what was she 45 there was some funni stori about the jealous old husband what was it at all and an oyster knife he went no he made her wear a kind of a tin thing round her and the princ of wale yes he had the oyster knife cant be true a thing like that like some of those book he bring me the work of master francoi somebodi suppos to be a priest about a child born out of her ear becaus her bumgut fell out a nice word for ani priest to write and her ae as if ani fool wouldnt know what that meant i hate that pretend of all thing with that old blackguard face on him anybodi can see it not true and that rubi and fair tyrant he brought me that twice i rememb when i came to page 5 o the part about where she hang him up out of a hook with a cord flagel sure there noth for a woman in that all invent made up about he drink the champagn out of her slipper after the ball was over like the infant jesus in the crib at inchicor in the bless virgin arm sure no woman could have a child that big taken out of her and i thought first it came out of her side becaus how could she go to the chamber when she want to and she a rich ladi of cours she felt honour h r h he was in gibraltar the year i was born i bet he found lili there too where he plant the tree he plant more than that in his time he might have plant me too if hed come a bit sooner then i wouldnt be here as i am he ought to chuck that freeman with the paltri few shill he knock out of it and go into an offic or someth where hed get regular pay or a bank where they could put him up on a throne to count the money all the day of cours he prefer plotter about the hous so you cant stir with him ani side what your programm today i wish hed even smoke a pipe like father to get the smell of a man or pretend to be mooch about for advertis when he could have been in mr cuff still onli for what he did then send me to tri and patch it up i could have got him promot there to be the manag he gave me a great mirada onc or twice first he was as stiff as the mischief realli and truli mrs bloom onli i felt rotten simpli with the old rubbishi dress that i lost the lead out of the tail with no cut in it but theyr come into fashion again i bought it simpli to pleas him i knew it was no good by the finish piti i chang my mind of go to todd and bum as i said and not lee it was just like the shop itself rummag sale a lot of trash i hate those rich shop get on your nerv noth kill me altogeth onli he think he know a great lot about a woman dress and cook mather everyth he can scour off the shelv into it if i went by his advic everi bless hat i put on doe that suit me yes take that that alright the one like a weddingcak stand up mile off my head he said suit me or the dishcov one come down on my backsid on pin and needl about the shopgirl in that place in grafton street i had the misfortun to bring him into and she as insol as ever she could be with her smirk say im afraid were give you too much troubl what shes there for but i stare it out of her yes he was aw stiff and no wonder but he chang the second time he look poldi pighead as usual like the soup but i could see him look veri hard at my chest when he stood up to open the door for me it was nice of him to show me out in ani case im extrem sorri mrs bloom believ me without make it too mark the first time after him be insult and me be suppos to be his wife i just half smile i know my chest was out that way at the door when he said im extrem sorri and im sure you were yes i think he made them a bit firmer suck them like that so long he made me thirsti titti he call them i had to laugh yes this one anyhow stiff the nippl get for the least thing ill get him to keep that up and ill take those egg beaten up with marsala fatten them out for him what are all those vein and thing curious the way it made 2 the same in case of twin theyr suppos to repres beauti place up there like those statu in the museum one of them pretend to hide it with her hand are they so beauti of cours compar with what a man look like with his two bag full and his other thing hang down out of him or stick up at you like a hatrack no wonder they hide it with a cabbageleaf that disgust cameron highland behind the meat market or that other wretch with the red head behind the tree where the statu of the fish use to be when i was pass pretend he was piss stand out for me to see it with his babycloth up to one side the queen own they were a nice lot it well the surrey reliev them theyr alway tri to show it to you everi time near i pass outsid the men greenhous near the harcourt street station just to tri some fellow or other tri to catch my eye as if it was i of the 7 wonder of the world o and the stink of those rotten place the night come home with poldi after the comerford parti orang and lemonad to make you feel nice and wateri i went into r of them it was so bite cold i couldnt keep it when was that 93 the canal was frozen yes it was a few month after a piti a coupl of the cameron werent there to see me squat in the men place meadero i tri to draw a pictur of it befor i tore it up like a sausag or someth i wonder theyr not afraid go about of get a kick or a bang of someth there the woman is beauti of cours that admit when he said i could pose for a pictur nake to some rich fellow in holl street when he lost the job in heli and i was sell the cloth and strum in the coffe palac would i be like that bath of the nymph with my hair down yes onli shes younger or im a littl like that dirti bitch in that spanish photo he has nymph use they go about like that i ask him about her and that word met someth with hose in it and he came out with some jawbreak about the incarn he never can explain a thing simpli the way a bodi can understand then he goe and burn the bottom out of the pan all for his kidney this one not so much there the mark of his teeth still where he tri to bite the nippl i had to scream out arent they fear tri to hurt you i had a great breast of milk with milli enough for two what was the reason of that he said i could have got a pound a week as a wet nurs all swell out the morn that delic look student that stop in no 28 with the citron penros near caught me wash through the window onli for i snap up the towel to my face that was his student hurt me they use to wean her till he got doctor bradi to give me the belladonna prescript i had to get him to suck them they were so hard he said it was sweeter and thicker than cow then he want to milk me into the tea well hes beyond everyth i declar somebodi ought to put him in the budget if i onli could rememb the i half of the thing and write a book out of it the work of master poldi yes and it so much smoother the skin much an hour he was at them im sure by the clock like some kind of a big infant i had at me they want everyth in their mouth all the pleasur those men get out of a woman i can feel his mouth o lord i must stretch myself i wish he was here or somebodi to let myself go with and come again like that i feel all fire insid me or if i could dream it when he made me spend the 2nd time tickl me behind with his finger i was come for about 5 minut with my leg round him i had to hug him after o lord i want to shout out all sort of thing fuck or shit or anyth at all onli not to look ugli or those line from the strain who know the way hed take it you want to feel your way with a man theyr not all like him thank god some of them want you to be so nice about it i notic the contrast he doe it and doesnt talk i gave my eye that look with my hair a bit loos from the tumbl and my tongu between my lip up to him the savag brute thursday friday one saturday two sunday three o lord i cant wait till monday frseeeeeeeefronnnng train somewher whistl the strength those engin have in them like big giant and the water roll all over and out of them all side like the end of love old sweeeetsonnnng the poor men that have to be out all the night from their wive and famili in those roast engin stifl it was today im glad i burn the half of those old freeman and photo bit leav thing like that lie about hes get veri careless and threw the rest of them up in the w c 111 get him to cut them tomorrow for me instead of have them there for the next year to get a few penc for them have him ask where last januari paper and all those old overcoat i bundl out of the hall make the place hotter than it is that rain was love and refresh just after my beauti sleep i thought it was go to get like gibraltar my good the heat there befor the levant came on black as night and the glare of the rock stand up in it like a big giant compar with their 3 rock mountain they think is so great with the red sentri here and there the poplar and they all whitehot and the smell of the rainwat in those tank watch the sun all the time welter down on you fade all that love frock father friend mrs stanhop sent me from the b march pari what a shame my dearest doggerina she wrote on it she was veri nice what this her other name was just a p c to tell you i sent the littl present have just had a jolli warm bath and feel a veri clean dog now enjoy it wogger she call him wogger wd give anyth to be back in gib and hear you sing wait and in old madrid concon is the name of those exercis he bought me one of those new some word i couldnt make out shawl amus thing but tear for the least thing still there love i think dont you will alway think of the love tea we had togeth scrumptious currant scone and raspberri wafer i ador well now dearest doggerina be sure and write soon kind she left out regard to your father also captain grove with love yrs affli hester x x x x x she didnt look a bit marri just like a girl he was year older than her wogger he was aw fond of me when he held down the wire with his foot for me to step over at the bullfight at la linea when that matador gomez was given the bull ear these cloth we have to wear whoever invent them expect you to walk up killiney hill then for exampl at that picnic all stays up you cant do a bless thing in them in a crowd run or jump out of the way that whi i was afraid when that other feroci old bull began to charg the banderillero with the sash and the 2 thing in their hat and the brute of men shout bravo toro sure the women were as bad in their nice white mantilla rip all the whole insid out of those poor hors i never heard of such a thing in all my life yes he use to break his heart at me take off the dog bark in bell lane poor brute and it sick what becam of them ever i suppos theyr dead long ago the 2 of them it like all through a mist make you feel so old i made the scone of cours i had everyth all to myself then a girl hester we use to compar our hair mine was thicker than her she show me how to settl it at the back when i put it up and what this els how to make a knot on a thread with the one hand we were like cousin what age was i then the night of the storm i slept in her bed she had her arm round me then we were fight in the morn with the pillow what fun he was watch me whenev he got an opportun at the band on the alameda esplanad when i was with father and captain grove i look up at the church first and then at the window then down and our eye met i felt someth go through me like all needl my eye were danc i rememb after when i look at myself in the glass hard recognis myself the chang he was attract to a girl in spite of his be a littl bald intellig look disappoint and gay at the same time he was like thoma in the shadow of ashlydyat i had a splendid skin from the sun and the excit like a rose i didnt get a wink of sleep it wouldnt have been nice on account of her but i could have stop it in time she gave me the moonston to read that was the first i read of wilki collin east lynn i read and the shadow of ashlydyat mrs henri wood henri dunbar by that other woman i lent him afterward with mulvey photo in it so as he see i wasnt without and lord lytton eugen aram molli bawn she gave me by mrs hungerford on account of the name i dont like book with a molli in them like that one he brought me about the one from flander a whore alway shoplift anyth she could cloth and stuff and yard of it o this blanket is too heavi on me that better i havent even one decent nightdress this thing get all roll under me besid him and his fool that better i use to be welter then in the heat my shift drench with the sweat stuck in the cheek of my bottom on the chair when i stood up they were so fattish and firm when i got up on the sofa cushion to see with my cloth up and the bug ton of them at night and the mosquito net i couldnt read a line lord how long ago it seem centuri of cours they never came back and she didnt put her address right on it either she may have notic her wogger peopl were alway go away and we never i rememb that day with the wave and the boat with their high head rock and the smell of ship those offic uniform on shore leav made me seasick he didnt say anyth he was veri serious i had the high button boot on and my skirt was blow she kiss me six or seven time didnt i cri yes i believ i did or near it my lip were taitter when i said goodby she had a gorgeous wrap of some special kind of blue colour on her for the voyag made veri peculiar to one side like and it was extrem pretti it got as dull as the devil after they went i was almost plan to run away mad out of it somewher were never easi where we are father or aunt or marriag wait alway wait to guiiiid him toooo me wait nor speeeed his fli feet their damn gun burst and boom all over the shop especi the queen birthday and throw everyth down in all direct if you didnt open the window when general ulyss grant whoever he was or did suppos to be some great fellow land off the ship and old spragu the consul that was there from befor the flood dress up poor man and he in mourn for the son then the same old bugl for reveill in the morn and drum roll and the unfortun poor devil of soldier walk about with messtin smell the place more than the old longbeard jew in their jellibe and levit assembl and sound clear and gunfir for the men to cross the line and the warden march with his key to lock the gate and the bagpip and onli captain grove and father talk about rork drift and plevna and sir garnet wolseley and gordon at khartoum light their pipe for them everytim they went out drunken old devil with his grog on the windowsil catch him leav ani of it pick his nose tri to think of some other dirti stori to tell up in a corner but he never forgot himself when i was there send me out of the room on some blind excus pay his compliment the bushmil whiski talk of cours but hed do the same to the next woman that came along i suppos he die of gallop drink age ago the day like year not a letter from a live soul except the odd few i post to myself with bit of paper in them so bore sometim i could fight with my nail listen to that old arab with the one eye and his heass of an instrument sing his heah heah aheah all my compriment on your hotchapotch of your heass as bad as now with the hand hang off me look out of the window if there was a nice fellow even in the opposit hous that medic in holl street the nurs was after when i put on my glove and hat at the window to show i was go out not a notion what i meant arent they thick never understand what you say even youd want to print it up on a big poster for them not even if you shake hand twice with the left he didnt recognis me either when i half frown at him outsid westland row chapel where doe their great intellig come in id like to know grey matter they have it all in their tail if you ask me those countri gouger up in the citi arm intellig they had a damn sight less than the bull and cow they were sell the meat and the coalman bell that noisi bugger tri to swindl me with the wrong bill he took out of his hat what a pair of paw and pot and pan and kettl to mend ani broken bottl for a poor man today and no visitor or post ever except his chequ or some advertis like that wonderwork they sent him address dear madam onli his letter and the card from milli this morn see she wrote a letter to him who did i get the last letter from o mrs dwenn now what possess her to write from canada after so mani year to know the recip i had for pisto madrileno floey dillon sinc she wrote to say she was marri to a veri rich architect if im to believ all i hear with a villa and eight room her father was an aw nice man he was near seventi alway goodhumour well now miss tweedi or miss gillespi there the piannyer that was a solid silver coffe servic he had too on the mahogani sideboard then die so far away i hate peopl that have alway their poor stori to tell everybodi has their own troubl that poor nanci blake die a month ago of acut neumonia well i didnt know her so well as all that she was floey friend more than mine poor nanci it a bother have to answer he alway tell me the wrong thing and no stop to say like make a speech your sad bereav symphathi i alway make that mistak and newphew with 2 doubl yous in i hope hell write me a longer letter the next time if it a thing he realli like me o thank be to the great god i got somebodi to give me what i bad want to put some heart up into me youv no chanc at all in this place like you use long ago i wish somebodi would write me a lovelett his wasnt much and i told him he could write what he like your ever hugh boylan in old madrid stuff silli women believ love is sigh i am die still if he wrote it i suppos there be some truth in it true or no it fill up your whole day and life alway someth to think about everi moment and see it all round you like a new world i could write the answer in bed to let him imagin me short just a few word not those long cross letter atti dillon use to write to the fellow that was someth in the four court that jilt her after out of the ladi letterwrit when i told her to say a few simpl word he could twist how he like not act with precipat precip itanc with equal candour the greatest earth happi answer to a gentleman propos affirm my good there noth els it all veri fine for them but as for be a woman as soon as your old they might as well throw you out in the bottom of the ashpit mulvey was the first when i was in bed that morn and mrs rubio brought it in with the coffe she stood there stand when i ask her to hand me and i point at them i couldnt think of the word a hairpin to open it with ah horquilla disoblig old thing and it stare her in the face with her switch of fals hair on her and vain about her appear ugli as she was near 80 or a loo her face a mass of wrinkl with all her religion domin becaus she never could get over the atlant fleet come in half the ship of the world and the union jack fli with all her carabinero becaus 4 drunken english sailor took all the rock from them and becaus i didnt run into mass often enough in santa maria to pleas her with her shawl up on her except when there was a marriag on with all her miracl of the saint and her black bless virgin with the silver dress and the sun danc 3 time on easter sunday morn and when the priest was go by with the bell bring the vatican to the die bless herself for his majestad an admir he sign it i near jump out of my skin i want to pick him up when i saw him follow me along the call real in the shop window then he tip me just in pass but i never thought hed write make an appoint i had it insid my petticoat bodic all day read it up in everi hole and corner while father was up at the drill instruct to find out by the handwrit or the languag of stamp sing i rememb shall i wear a white rose and i want to put on the old stupid clock to near the time he was the first man kiss me under the moorish wall my sweetheart when a boy it never enter my head what kiss meant till he put his tongu in my mouth his mouth was sweetlik young i put my knee up to him a few time to learn the way what did i tell him i was engag for for fun to the son of a spanish nobleman name don miguel de la flora and he believ me that i was to be marri to him in 3 year time there mani a true word spoken in jest there is a flower that bloometh a few thing i told him true about myself just for him to be imagin the spanish girl he didnt like i suppos one of them wouldnt have him i got him excit he crush all the flower on my bosom he brought me he couldnt count the peseta and the perragorda till i taught him cappoquin he came from he said on the black water but it was too short then the day befor he left may yes it was may when the infant king of spain was born im alway like that in the spring id like a new fellow everi year up on the tiptop under the rockgun near ohara tower i told him it was struck by lightn and all about the old barbari ape they sent to clapham without a tail career all over the show on each other back mrs rubio said she was a regular old rock scorpion rob the chicken out of inc farm and throw stone at you if you went anear he was look at me i had that white blous on open in the front to encourag him as much as i could without too open they were just begin to be plump i said i was tire we lay over the firtre cove a wild place i suppos it must be the highest rock in exist the galleri and casem and those fright rock and saint michael cave with the icicl or whatev they call them hang down and ladder all the mud plotch my boot im sure that the way down the monkey go under the sea to africa when they die the ship out far like chip that was the malta boat pass yes the sea and the sky you could do what you like lie there for ever he caress them outsid they love do that it the round there i was lean over him with my white ricestraw hat to take the new out of it the left side of my face the best my blous open for his last day transpar kind of shirt he had i could see his chest pink he want to touch mine with his for a moment but i wouldnt lee him he was aw put out first for fear you never know consumpt or leav me with a child embarazada that old servant ine told me that one drop even if it got into you at all after i tri with the banana but i was afraid it might break and get lost up in me somewher becaus they onc took someth down out of a woman that was up there for year cover with limesalt theyr all mad to get in there where they come out of youd think they could never go far enough up and then theyr done with you in a way till the next time yes becaus there a wonder feel there so tender all the time how did we finish it off yes o yes i pull him off into my handkerchief pretend not to be excit but i open my leg i wouldnt let him touch me insid my petticoat becaus i had a skirt open up the side i torment the life out of him first tickl him i love rous that dog in the hotel rrrsssstt awokwokawok his eye shut and a bird fli below us he was shi all the same i like him like that moan i made him blush a littl when i got over him that way when i unbutton him and took his out and drew back the skin it had a kind of eye in it theyr all button men down the middl on the wrong side of them molli darl he call me what was his name jack joe harri mulvey was it yes i think a lieuten he was rather fair he had a laugh kind of a voic so i went round to the whatyoucallit everyth was whatyoucallit moustach had he he said hed come back lord it just like yesterday to me and if i was marri hed do it to me and i promis him yes faith id let him block me now fli perhap hes dead or kill or a captain or admir it near 20 year if i said firtre cove he would if he came up behind me and put his hand over my eye to guess who i might recognis him hes young still about 40 perhap hes marri some girl on the black water and is quit chang they all do they havent half the charact a woman has she littl know what i did with her belov husband befor he ever dreamt of her in broad daylight too in the sight of the whole world you might say they could have put an articl about it in the chronicl i was a bit wild after when i blew out the old bag the biscuit were in from benadi bros and explod it lord what a bang all the woodcock and pigeon scream come back the same way that we went over middl hill round by the old guardhous and the jew burialplac pretend to read out the hebrew on them i want to fire his pistol he said he hadnt one he didnt know what to make of me with his peak cap on that he alway wore crook as often as i settl it straight h m s calypso swing my hat that old bishop that spoke off the altar his long preach about woman higher function about girl now ride the bicycl and wear peak cap and the new woman bloomer god send him sens and me more money i suppos theyr call after him i never thought that would be my name bloom when i use to write it in print to see how it look on a visit card or practis for the butcher and oblig m bloom your look bloom josi use to say after i marri him well it better than breen or brigg doe brig or those aw name with bottom in them mrs ramsbottom or some other kind of a bottom mulvey i wouldnt go mad about either or suppos i divorc him mrs boylan my mother whoever she was might have given me a nicer name the lord know after the love one she had lunita laredo the fun we had run along williss road to europa point twist in and out all round the other side of jersey they were shake and danc about in my blous like milli littl one now when she run up the stair i love look down at them i was jump up at the pepper tree and the white poplar pull the leav off and throw them at him he went to india he was to write the voyag those men have to make to the end of the world and back it the least they might get a squeez or two at a woman while they can go out to be drown or blown up somewher i went up windmil hill to the flat that sunday morn with captain rubio that was dead spyglass like the sentri had he said hed have one or two from on board i wore that frock from the b march pari and the coral necklac the strait shine i could see over to morocco almost the bay of tangier white and the atlas mountain with snow on it and the strait like a river so clear harri molli darl i was think of him on the sea all the time after at mass when my petticoat began to slip down at the elev week and week i kept the handkerchief under my pillow for the smell of him there was no decent perfum to be got in that gibraltar onli that cheap peau despagn that fade and left a stink on you more than anyth els i want to give him a memento he gave me that clumsi claddagh ring for luck that i gave gardner go to south africa where those boer kill him with their war and fever but they were well beaten all the same as if it brought it bad luck with it like an opal or pearl still it must have been pure 18 carrot gold becaus it was veri heavi but what could you get in a place like that the sandfrog shower from africa and that derelict ship that came up to the harbour mari the mari whatyoucallit no he hadnt a moustach that was gardner yes i can see his face cleanshaven frseeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeefrong that train again weep tone onc in the dear deaead day beyondr call close my eye breath my lip forward kiss sad look eye open piano ere oer the world the mist began i hate that istsbeg come love sweet sooooooooooong ill let that out full when i get in front of the footlight again kathleen kearney and her lot of squealer miss this miss that miss theother lot of sparrowfart skit around talk about polit they know as much about as my backsid anyth in the world to make themselv someway interest irish homemad beauti soldier daughter am i ay and whose are you bootmak and publican i beg your pardon coach i thought you were a wheelbarrow theyd die down dead off their feet if ever they got a chanc of walk down the alameda on an offic arm like me on the bandnight my eye flash my bust that they havent passion god help their poor head i knew more about men and life when i was i s than theyll all know at 50 they dont know how to sing a song like that gardner said no man could look at my mouth and teeth smile like that and not think of it i was afraid he mightnt like my accent first he so english all father left me in spite of his stamp ive my mother eye and figur anyhow he alway said theyr so snotti about themselv some of those cad he wasnt a bit like that he was dead gone on my lip let them get a husband first that fit to be look at and a daughter like mine or see if they can excit a swell with money that can pick and choos whoever he want like boylan to do it 4 or 5 time lock in each other arm or the voic either i could have been a prima donna onli i marri him come loooov old deep down chin back not too much make it doubl my ladi bower is too long for an encor about the moat grang at twilight and vaunt room yes ill sing wind that blow from the south that he gave after the choirstair perform ill chang that lace on my black dress to show off my bub and ill yes by god ill get that big fan mend make them burst with envi my hole is itch me alway when i think of him i feel i want to i feel some wind in me better go easi not wake him have him at it again slobber after wash everi bit of myself back belli and side if we had even a bath itself or my own room anyway i wish hed sleep in some bed by himself with his cold feet on me give us room even to let a fart god or do the least thing better yes hold them like that a bit on my side piano quiet sweeeee there that train far away pianissimo eeeee one more song that was a relief wherev you be let your wind go free who know if that pork chop i took with my cup of tea after was quit good with the heat i couldnt smell anyth off it im sure that queerlook man in the porkbutch is a great rogu i hope that lamp is not smoke fill my nose up with smut better than have him leav the gas on all night i couldnt rest easi in my bed in gibraltar even get up to see whi am i so damn nervous about that though i like it in the winter it more compani o lord it was rotten cold too that winter when i was onli about ten was i yes i had the big doll with all the funni cloth dress her up and undress that ici wind skeet across from those mountain the someth nevada sierra nevada stand at the fire with the littl bit of a short shift i had up to heat myself i love danc about in it then make a race back into bed im sure that fellow opposit use to be there the whole time watch with the light out in the summer and i in my skin hop around i use to love myself then strip at the washstand dab and cream onli when it came to the chamber perform i put out the light too so then there were 2 of us goodby to my sleep for this night anyhow i hope hes not go to get in with those medic lead him astray to imagin hes young again come in at 4 in the morn it must be if not more still he had the manner not to wake me what do they find to gabber about all night squander money and get drunker and drunker couldnt they drink water then he start give us his order for egg and tea and findon haddi and hot butter toast i suppos well have him sit up like the king of the countri pump the wrong end of the spoon up and down in his egg wherev he learn that from and i love to hear him fall up the stair of a morn with the cup rattl on the tray and then play with the cat she rub up against you for her own sake i wonder has she flea shes as bad as a woman alway lick and leck but i hate their claw i wonder do they see anyth that we cant stare like that when she sit at the top of the stair so long and listen as i wait alway what a robber too that love fresh place i bought i think ill get a bit of fish tomorrow or today is it friday yes i will with some blancmang with black currant jam like long ago not those 2 lb pot of mix plum and appl from the london and newcastl william and wood goe twice as far onli for the bone i hate those eel cod yes ill get a nice piec of cod im alway get enough for 3 forget anyway im sick of that everlast butcher meat from buckley loin chop and leg beef and rib steak and scrag of mutton and calf pluck the veri name is enough or a picnic suppos we all gave 5/ each and or let him pay it and invit some other woman for him who mrs fleme and drove out to the furri glen or the strawberri bed wed have him examin all the hors toenail first like he doe with the letter no not with boylan there yes with some cold veal and ham mix sandwich there are littl hous down at the bottom of the bank there on purpos but it as hot as blaze he say not a bank holiday anyhow i hate those ruck of mari ann coalbox out for the day whit monday is a curs day too no wonder that bee bit him better the seasid but id never again in this life get into a boat with him after him at bray tell the boatman he knew how to row if anyon ask could he ride the steeplechas for the gold cup hed say yes then it came on to get rough the old thing crooked about and the weight all down my side tell me pull the right rein now pull the left and the tide all swamp in flood in through the bottom and his oar slip out of the stirrup it a merci we werent all drown he can swim of cours me no there no danger whatsoev keep yourself calm in his flannel trouser id like to have tatter them down off him befor all the peopl and give him what that one call flagel till he was black and blue do him all the good in the world onli for that longnos chap i dont know who he is with that other beauti burk out of the citi arm hotel was there spi around as usual on the slip alway where he wasnt want if there was a row on youd vomit a better face there was no love lost between us that 1 consol i wonder what kind is that book he brought me sweet of sin by a gentleman of fashion some other mr de kock i suppos the peopl gave him that nicknam go about with his tube from one woman to anoth i couldnt even chang my new white shoe all ruin with the saltwat and the hat i had with that feather all blowi and toss on me how annoy and provok becaus the smell of the sea excit me of cours the sardin and the bream in catalan bay round the back of the rock they were fine all silver in the fishermen basket old luigi near a hundr they said came from genoa and the tall old chap with the earring i dont like a man you have to climb up to to get at i suppos theyr all dead and rotten long ago besid i dont like be alon in this big barrack of a place at night i suppos ill have to put up with it i never brought a bit of salt in even when we move in the confus music academi he was go to make on the first floor drawingroom with a brassplat or bloom privat hotel he suggest go and ruin himself altogeth the way his father did down in enni like all the thing he told father he was go to do and me but i saw through him tell me all the love place we could go for the honeymoon venic by moonlight with the gondola and the lake of como he had a pictur cut out of some paper of and mandolin and lantern o how nice i said whatev i like he was go to do immedi if not sooner will you be my man will you carri my can he ought to get a leather medal with a putti rim for all the plan he invent then leav us here all day youd never know what old beggar at the door for a crust with his long stori might be a tramp and put his foot in the way to prevent me shut it like that pictur of that harden crimin he was call in lloyd week news 20 year in jail then he come out and murder an old woman for her money imagin his poor wife or mother or whoever she is such a face youd run mile away from i couldnt rest easi till i bolt all the door and window to make sure but it wors again be lock up like in a prison or a madhous they ought to be all shot or the cat of nine tail a big brute like that that would attack a poor old woman to murder her in her bed id cut them off him so i would not that hed be much use still better than noth the night i was sure i heard burglar in the kitchen and he went down in his shirt with a candl and a poker as if he was look for a mous as white as a sheet frighten out of his wit make as much nois as he possibl could for the burglar benefit there isnt much to steal inde the lord know still it the feel especi now with milli away such an idea for him to send the girl down there to learn to take photograph on account of his grandfath instead of send her to skerri academi where shed have to learn not like me get all is at school onli hed do a thing like that all the same on account of me and boylan that whi he did it im certain the way he plot and plan everyth out i couldnt turn round with her in the place late unless i bolt the door first gave me the fidget come in without knock first when i put the chair against the door just as i was wash myself there below with the glove get on your nerv then do the logladi all day put her in a glasscas with two at a time to look at her if he knew she broke off the hand off that littl gimcrack statu with her rough and careless befor she left that i got that littl italian boy to mend so that you cant see the join for 2 shill wouldnt even teem the potato for you of cours shes right not to ruin her hand i notic he was alway talk to her late at the tabl explain thing in the paper and she pretend to understand sli of cours that come from his side of the hous he cant say i pretend thing can he im too honest as a matter of fact and help her into her coat but if there was anyth wrong with her it me shed tell not him i suppos he think im finish out and laid on the shelf well im not no nor anyth like it well see well see now shes well on for flirt too with tom devan two son imit me whistl with those romp of murray girl call for her can milli come out pleas shes in great demand to pick what they can out of her round in nelson street ride harri devan bicycl at night it as well he sent her where she is she was just get out of bound want to go on the skatingrink and smoke their cigarett through their nose i smelt it off her dress when i was bite off the thread of the button i sew on to the bottom of her jacket she couldnt hide much from me i tell you onli i oughtnt to have stitch it and it on her it bring a part and the last plumpud too split in 2 halv see it come out no matter what they say her tongu is a bit too long for my tast your blous is open too low she say to me the pan call the kettl blackbottom and i had to tell her not to cock her leg up like that on show on the windowsil befor all the peopl pass they all look at her like me when i was her age of cours ani old rag look well on you then a great touchmenot too in her own way at the onli way in the theatr royal take your foot away out of that i hate peopl touch me afraid of her life id crush her skirt with the pleat a lot of that touch must go on in theatr in the crush in the dark theyr alway tri to wiggl up to you that fellow in the pit at the gaieti for beerbohm tree in trilbi the last time ill ever go there to be squash like that for ani trilbi or her barebum everi two minut tip me there and look away hes a bit daft i think i saw him after tri to get near two stylishdress ladi outsid switzer window at the same littl game i recognis him on the moment the face and everyth but he didnt rememb me yes and she didnt even want me to kiss her at the broadston go away well i hope shell get someon to danc attend on her the way i did when she was down with the mump and her gland swollen where this and where that of cours she cant feel anyth deep yet i never came proper till i was what 22 or so it went into the wrong place alway onli the usual girl nonsens and giggl that conni connolli write to her in white ink on black paper seal with sealingwax though she clap when the curtain came down becaus he look so handsom then we had martin harvey for breakfast dinner and supper i thought to myself afterward it must be real love if a man give up his life for her that way for noth i suppos there are a few men like that left it hard to believ in it though unless it realli happen to me the major of them with not a particl of love in their natur to find two peopl like that nowaday full up of each other that would feel the same way as you do theyr usual a bit foolish in the head his father must have been a bit queer to go and poison himself after her still poor old man i suppos he felt lost shes alway make love to my thing too the few old rag i have want to put her hair up at i s my powder too onli ruin her skin on her shes time enough for that all her life after of cours shes restless know shes pretti with her lip so red a piti they wont stay that way i was too but there no use go to the fair with the thing answer me like a fishwoman when i ask to go for a half a stone of potato the day we met mrs joe gallah at the trottingmatch and she pretend not to see us in her trap with frieri the solicitor we werent grand enough till i gave her 2 damn fine crack across the ear for herself take that now for answer me like that and that for your impud she had me that exasper of cours contradict i was badtemp too becaus how was it there was a weed in the tea or i didnt sleep the night befor chees i ate was it and i told her over and over again not to leav knive cross like that becaus she has nobodi to command her as she said herself well if he doesnt correct her faith i will that was the last time she turn on the teartap i was just like that myself they darent order me about the place it his fault of cours have the two of us slave here instead of get in a woman long ago am i ever go to have a proper servant again of cours then shed see him come id have to let her know or shed reveng it arent they a nuisanc that old mrs fleme you have to be walk round after her put the thing into her hand sneez and fart into the pot well of cours shes old she cant help it a good job i found that rotten old smelli dishcloth that got lost behind the dresser i knew there was someth and open the area window to let out the smell bring in his friend to entertain them like the night he walk home with a dog if you pleas that might have been mad especi simon dedalus son his father such a criticis with his glass up with his tall hat on him at the cricket match and a great big hole in his sock one thing laugh at the other and his son that got all those prize for whatev he won them in the intermedi imagin climb over the rail if anybodi saw him that knew us i wonder he didnt tear a big hole in his grand funer trouser as if the one natur gave wasnt enough for anybodi hawk him down into the dirti old kitchen now is he right in his head i ask piti it wasnt wash day my old pair of drawer might have been hang up too on the line on exhibit for all hed ever care with the ironmould mark the stupid old bundl burn on them he might think was someth els and she never even render down the fat i told her and now shes go such as she was on account of her paralys husband get wors there alway someth wrong with them diseas or they have to go under an oper or if it not that it drink and he beat her ill have to hunt around again for someon everi day i get up there some new thing on sweet god sweet god well when im stretch out dead in my grave i suppos 111 have some peac i want to get up a minut if im let wait o jesus wait yes that thing has come on me yes now wouldnt that afflict you of cours all the poke and root and plough he had up in me now what am i to do friday saturday sunday wouldnt that pester the soul out of a bodi unless he like it some men do god know there alway someth wrong with us 5 day everi 3 or 4 week usual month auction isnt it simpli sicken that night it came on me like that the one and onli time we were in a box that michael gunn gave him to see mrs kendal and her husband at the gaieti someth he did about insur for him in drimmi i was fit to be tie though i wouldnt give in with that gentleman of fashion stare down at me with his glass and him the other side of me talk about spinoza and his soul that dead i suppos million of year ago i smile the best i could all in a swamp lean forward as if i was interest have to sit it out then to the last tag i wont forget that wife of scar in a hurri suppos to be a fast play about adulteri that idiot in the galleri hiss the woman adulteress he shout i suppos he went and had a woman in the next lane run round all the back way after to make up for it i wish he had what i had then hed boo i bet the cat itself is better off than us have we too much blood up in us or what o patienc abov it pour out of me like the sea anyhow he didnt make me pregnant as big as he is i dont want to ruin the clean sheet i just put on i suppos the clean linen i wore brought it on too damn it damn it and they alway want to see a stain on the bed to know your a virgin for them all that troubl them theyr such fool too you could be a widow or divorc 40 time over a daub of red ink would do or blackberri juic no that too purpli o jamesi let me up out of this pooh sweet of sin whoever suggest that busi for women what between cloth and cook and children this damn old bed too jingl like the dicken i suppos they could hear us away over the other side of the park till i suggest to put the quilt on the floor with the pillow under my bottom i wonder is it nicer in the day i think it is easi i think ill cut all this hair off me there scald me i might look like a young girl wouldnt he get the great suckin the next time he turn up my cloth on me id give anyth to see his face where the chamber gone easi ive a holi horror of it break under me after that old commod i wonder was i too heavi sit on his knee i made him sit on the easychair purpos when i took off onli my blous and skirt first in the other room he was so busi where he oughtnt to be he never felt me i hope my breath was sweet after those kiss comfit easi god i rememb one time i could scout it out straight whistl like a man almost easi o lord how noisi i hope theyr bubbl on it for a wad of money from some fellow 111 have to perfum it in the morn dont forget i bet he never saw a better pair of thigh than that look how white they are the smoothest place is right there between this bit here how soft like a peach easi god i wouldnt mind be a man and get up on a love woman o lord what a row your make like the jersey lili easi easi o how the water come down at lahor who know is there anyth the matter with my insid or have i someth grow in me get that thing like that everi week when was it last i whit monday yes it onli about 3 week i ought to go to the doctor onli it would be like befor i marri him when i had that white thing come from me and floey made me go to that dri old stick dr collin for women diseas on pembrok road your vagina he call it i suppos that how he got all the gilt mirror and carpet get round those rich one off stephen green run up to him for everi littl fiddlefaddl her vagina and her cochinchina theyv money of cours so theyr all right i wouldnt marri him not if he was the last man in the world besid there someth queer about their children alway smell around those filthi bitch all side ask me if what i did had an offens odour what did he want me to do but the one thing gold mayb what a question if i smather it all over his wrink old face for him with all my compriment i suppos hed know then and could you pass it easili pass what i thought he was talk about the rock of gibraltar the way he put it that a veri nice invent too by the way onli i like let myself down after in the hole as far as i can squeez and pull the chain then to flush it nice cool pin and needl still there someth in it i suppos i alway use to know by milli when she was a child whether she had worm or not still all the same pay him for that how much is that doctor one guinea pleas and ask me had i frequent omiss where do those old fellow get all the word they have omiss with his shortsight eye on me cock sideway i wouldnt trust him too far to give me chloroform or god know what els still i like him when he sat down to write the thing out frown so sever his nose intellig like that you be damn you lie strap o anyth no matter who except an idiot he was clever enough to spot that of cours that was all think of him and his mad crazi letter my precious one everyth connect with your glorious bodi everyth underlin that come from it is a thing of beauti and of joy for ever someth he got out of some nonsens book that he had me alway at myself 4 and 5 time a day sometim and i said i hadnt are you sure o yes i said i am quit sure in a way that shut him up i knew what was come next onli natur weak it was he excit me i dont know how the first night ever we met when i was live in rehoboth terrac we stood stare at one anoth for about lo minut as if we met somewher i suppos on account of my be jewess look after my mother he use to amus me the thing he said with the half sloother smile on him and all the doyl said he was go to stand for a member of parliament o wasnt i the born fool to believ all his blather about home rule and the land leagu send me that long strool of a song out of the huguenot to sing in french to be more classi o beau pay de la tourain that i never even sang onc explain and rigmarol about religion and persecut he wont let you enjoy anyth natur then might he as a great favour the veri 1st opportun he got a chanc in brighton squar run into my bedroom pretend the ink got on his hand to wash it off with the albion milk and sulphur soap i use to use and the gelatin still round it o i laugh myself sick at him that day i better not make an alnight sit on this affair they ought to make chamber a natur size so that a woman could sit on it proper he kneel down to do it i suppos there isnt in all creation anoth man with the habit he has look at the way hes sleep at the foot of the bed how can he without a hard bolster it well he doesnt kick or he might knock out all my teeth breath with his hand on his nose like that indian god he took me to show one wet sunday in the museum in kildar street all yellow in a pinafor lie on his side on his hand with his ten toe stick out that he said was a bigger religion than the jew and our lord both put togeth all over asia imit him as hes alway imit everybodi i suppos he use to sleep at the foot of the bed too with his big squar feet up in his wife mouth damn this stink thing anyway where this those napkin are ah yes i know i hope the old press doesnt creak ah i knew it would hes sleep hard had a good time somewher still she must have given him great valu for his money of cours he has to pay for it from her o this nuisanc of a thing i hope theyll have someth better for us in the other world tie ourselv up god help us that all right for tonight now the lumpi old jing bed alway remind me of old cohen i suppos he scratch himself in it often enough and he think father bought it from lord napier that i use to admir when i was a littl girl becaus i told him easi piano o i like my bed god here we are as bad as ever after 16 year how mani hous were we in at all raymond terrac and ontario terrac and lombard street and holl street and he goe about whistl everi time were on the run again his huguenot or the frog march pretend to help the men with our 4 stick of furnitur and then the citi arm hotel wors and wors say warden dali that charm place on the land alway somebodi insid pray then leav all their stink after them alway know who was in there last everi time were just get on right someth happen or he put his big foot in it thom and heli and mr cuff and drimmi either hes go to be run into prison over his old lotteri ticket that was to be all our salvat or he goe and give impud well have him come home with the sack soon out of the freeman too like the rest on account of those sinner fein or the freemason then well see if the littl man he show me dribbl along in the wet all by himself round by coadi lane will give him much consol that he say is so capabl and sincer irish he is inde judg by the sincer of the trouser i saw on him wait there georg church bell wait 3 quarter the hour l wait 2 oclock well that a nice hour of the night for him to be come home at to anybodi climb down into the area if anybodi saw him ill knock him off that littl habit tomorrow first ill look at his shirt to see or ill see if he has that french letter still in his pocketbook i suppos he think i dont know deceit men all their 20 pocket arent enough for their lie then whi should we tell them even if it the truth they dont believ you then tuck up in bed like those babi in the aristocrat masterpiec he brought me anoth time as if we hadnt enough of that in real life without some old aristocrat or whatev his name is disgust you more with those rotten pictur children with two head and no leg that the kind of villaini theyr alway dream about with not anoth thing in their empti head they ought to get slow poison the half of them then tea and toast for him butter on both side and newlaid egg i suppos im noth ani more when i wouldnt let him lick me in holl street one night man man tyrant as ever for the one thing he slept on the floor half the night nake the way the jew use when somebodi die belong to them and wouldnt eat ani breakfast or speak a word want to be pet so i thought i stood out enough for one time and let him he doe it all wrong too think onli of his own pleasur his tongu is too flat or i dont know what he forget that wethen i dont ill make him do it again if he doesnt mind himself and lock him down to sleep in the coalcellar with the blackbeetl i wonder was it her josi off her head with my castoff hes such a born liar too no hed never have the courag with a marri woman that whi he want me and boylan though as for her deni as she call him that forlornlook spectacl you couldnt call him a husband yes it some littl bitch hes got in with even when i was with him with milli at the colleg race that hornblow with the child bonnet on the top of his nob let us into by the back way he was throw his sheep eye at those two do skirt duti up and down i tri to wink at him first no use of cours and that the way his money goe this is the fruit of mr paddi dignam yes they were all in great style at the grand funer in the paper boylan brought in if they saw a real offic funer thatd be someth revers arm muffl drum the poor hors walk behind in black l boom and tom kernan that drunken littl barrelli man that bit his tongu off fall down the men w c drunk in some place or other and martin cunningham and the two dedalus and fanni mcoy husband white head of cabbag skinni thing with a turn in her eye tri to sing my song shed want to be born all over again and her old green dress with the lowneck as she cant attract them ani other way like dabbl on a raini day i see it all now plain and they call that friendship kill and then buri one anoth and they all with their wive and famili at home more especi jack power keep that barmaid he doe of cours his wife is alway sick or go to be sick or just get better of it and hes a goodlook man still though hes get a bit grey over the ear theyr a nice lot all of them well theyr not go to get my husband again into their clutch if i can help it make fun of him then behind his back i know well when he goe on with his idiot becaus he has sens enough not to squander everi penni piec he earn down their gullet and look after his wife and famili goodfornoth poor paddi dignam all the same im sorri in a way for him what are his wife and 5 children go to do unless he was insur comic littl teetotum alway stuck up in some pub corner and her or her son wait bill bailey wont you pleas come home her widow weed wont improv her appear theyr aw becom though if your goodlook what men wasnt he yes he was at the glencre dinner and ben dollard base barrelton the night he borrow the swallowtail to sing out of in holl street squeez and squash into them and grin all over his big dolli face like a wellwhip child botti didnt he look a balmi ballock sure enough that must have been a spectacl on the stage imagin pay 5/ in the preserv seat for that to see him trot off in his trowler and simon dedalus too he was alway turn up half screw sing the second vers first the old love is the new was one of his so sweet sang the maiden on the hawthorn bough he was alway on for flirtyfi too when i sang maritana with him at freddi mayer privat opera he had a delici glorious voic phoeb dearest goodby sweet heart sweetheart he alway sang it not like bartel darci sweet tart goodby of cours he had the gift of the voic so there was no art in it all over you like a warm showerbath o maritana wildwood flower we sang splendid though it was a bit too high for my regist even transpos and he was marri at the time to may gould but then hed say or do someth to knock the good out of it hes a widow now i wonder what sort is his son he say hes an author and go to be a univers professor of italian and im to take lesson what is he drive at now show him my photo it not good of me i ought to have got it taken in draperi that never look out of fashion still i look young in it i wonder he didnt make him a present of it altogeth and me too after all whi not i saw him drive down to the kingsbridg station with his father and mother i was in mourn that 11 year ago now yes hed be 11 though what was the good in go into mourn for what was neither one thing nor the other the first cri was enough for me i heard the deathwatch too tick in the wall of cours he insist hed go into mourn for the cat i suppos hes a man now by this time he was an innoc boy then and a darl littl fellow in his lord fauntleroy suit and cur hair like a princ on the stage when i saw him at mat dillon he like me too i rememb they all do wait by god yes wait yes hold on he was on the card this morn when i laid out the deck union with a young stranger neither dark nor fair you met befor i thought it meant him but hes no chicken nor a stranger either besid my face was turn the other way what was the 7th card after that the 10 of spade for a journey by land then there was a letter on it way and scandal too the 3 queen and the 8 of diamond for a rise in societi yes wait it all came out and 2 red 8s for new garment look at that and didnt i dream someth too yes there was someth about poetri in it i hope he hasnt long greasi hair hang into his eye or stand up like a red indian what do they go about like that for onli get themselv and their poetri laugh at i alway like poetri when i was a girl first i thought he was a poet like lord byron and not an ounc of it in his composit i thought he was quit differ i wonder is he too young hes about wait 88 i was marri 88 milli is 15 yesterday 89 what age was he then at dillon 5 or 6 about 88 i suppos hes 20 or more im not too old for him if hes 23 or 24 i hope hes not that stuckup univers student sort no otherwis he wouldnt go sit down in the old kitchen with him take eppss cocoa and talk of cours he pretend to understand it all probabl he told him he was out of triniti colleg hes veri young to be a professor i hope hes not a professor like goodwin was he was a potent professor of john jameson they all write about some woman in their poetri well i suppos he wont find mani like me where soft sigh of love the light guitar where poetri is in the air the blue sea and the moon shine so beauti come back on the nightboat from tarifa the lighthous at europa point the guitar that fellow play was so express will i ever go back there again all new face two glanc eye a lattic hid ill sing that for him theyr my eye if hes anyth of a poet two eye as dark bright as love own star arent those beauti word as love young star itll be a chang the lord know to have an intellig person to talk to about yourself not alway listen to him and billi prescott ad and keyess ad and tom the devil ad then if anyth goe wrong in their busi we have to suffer im sure hes veri distinguish id like to meet a man like that god not those other ruck besid hes young those fine young men i could see down in margat strand bathingplac from the side of the rock stand up in the sun nake like a god or someth and then plung into the sea with them whi arent all men like that there be some consol for a woman like that love littl statu he bought i could look at him all day long cur head and his shoulder his finger up for you to listen there real beauti and poetri for you i often felt i want to kiss him all over also his love young cock there so simpl i wouldnt mind take him in my mouth if nobodi was look as if it was ask you to suck it so clean and white he look with his boyish face i would too in 1/2 a minut even if some of it went down what it onli like gruel or the dew there no danger besid hed be so clean compar with those pig of men i suppos never dream of wash it from i year end to the other the most of them onli that what give the women the moustach im sure itll be grand if i can onli get in with a handsom young poet at my age ill throw them the 1st thing in the morn till i see if the wishcard come out or ill tri pair the ladi herself and see if he come out ill read and studi all i can find or learn a bit off by heart if i knew who he like so he wont think me stupid if he think all women are the same and i can teach him the other part ill make him feel all over him till he half faint under me then hell write about me lover and mistress public too with our 2 photograph in all the paper when he becom famous o but then what am i go to do about him though no that no way for him has he no manner nor no refin nor no noth in his natur slap us behind like that on my bottom becaus i didnt call him hugh the ignoramus that doesnt know poetri from a cabbag that what you get for not keep them in their proper place pull off his shoe and trouser there on the chair befor me so barefac without even ask permiss and stand out that vulgar way in the half of a shirt they wear to be admir like a priest or a butcher or those old hypocrit in the time of julius caesar of cours hes right enough in his way to pass the time as a joke sure you might as well be in bed with what with a lion god im sure hed have someth better to say for himself an old lion would o well i suppos it becaus they were so plump and tempt in my short petticoat he couldnt resist they excit myself sometim it well for men all the amount of pleasur they get off a woman bodi were so round and white for them alway i wish i was one myself for a chang just to tri with that thing they have swell up on you so hard and at the same time so soft when you touch it my uncl john has a thing long i heard those cornerboy say pass the comer of marrowbon lane my aunt mari has a thing hairi becaus it was dark and they knew a girl was pass it didnt make me blush whi should it either it onli natur and he put his thing long into my aunt mari hairi etcetera and turn out to be you put the handl in a sweepingbrush men again all over they can pick and choos what they pleas a marri woman or a fast widow or a girl for their differ tast like those hous round behind irish street no but were to be alway chain up theyr not go to be chain me up no damn fear onc i start i tell you for their stupid husband jealousi whi cant we all remain friend over it instead of quarrel her husband found it out what they did togeth well natur and if he did can he undo it hes coronado anyway whatev he doe and then he go to the other mad extrem about the wife in fair tyrant of cours the man never even cast a 2nd thought on the husband or wife either it the woman he want and he get her what els were we given all those desir for id like to know i cant help it if im young still can i it a wonder im not an old shrivel hag befor my time live with him so cold never embrac me except sometim when hes asleep the wrong end of me not know i suppos who he has ani man thatd kiss a woman bottom id throw my hat at him after that hed kiss anyth unnatur where we havent i atom of ani kind of express in us all of us the same 2 lump of lard befor ever id do that to a man pfooh the dirti brute the mere thought is enough i kiss the feet of you senorita there some sens in that didnt he kiss our halldoor yes he did what a madman nobodi understand his crack idea but me still of cours a woman want to be embrac 20 time a day almost to make her look young no matter by who so long as to be in love or love by somebodi if the fellow you want isnt there sometim by the lord god i was think would i go around by the quay there some dark even where nobodyd know me and pick up a sailor off the sea thatd be hot on for it and not care a pin whose i was onli do it off up in a gate somewher or one of those wildlook gipsi in rathfarnham had their camp pitch near the bloomfield laundri to tri and steal our thing if they could i onli sent mine there a few time for the name model laundri send me back over and over some old one odd stock that blackguardlook fellow with the fine eye peel a switch attack me in the dark and ride me up against the wall without a word or a murder anybodi what they do themselv the fine gentlemen in their silk hat that k c live up somewher this way come out of hardwick lane the night he gave us the fish supper on account of win over the box match of cours it was for me he gave it i knew him by his gaiter and the walk and when i turn round a minut after just to see there was a woman after come out of it too some filthi prostitut then he goe home to his wife after that onli i suppos the half of those sailor are rotten again with diseas o move over your big carcass out of that for the love of mike listen to him the wind that waft my sigh to thee so well he may sleep and sigh the great suggest don poldo de la flora if he knew how he came out on the card this morn hed have someth to sigh for a dark man in some perplex between 2 7s too in prison for lord know what he doe that i dont know and im to be slooch around down in the kitchen to get his lordship his breakfast while hes roll up like a mummi will i inde did you ever see me run id just like to see myself at it show them attent and they treat you like dirt i dont care what anybodi say itd be much better for the world to be govern by the women in it you wouldnt see women go and kill one anoth and slaughter when do you ever see women roll around drunk like they do or gambl everi penni they have and lose it on hors yes becaus a woman whatev she doe she know where to stop sure they wouldnt be in the world at all onli for us they dont know what it is to be a woman and a mother how could they where would they all of them be if they hadnt all a mother to look after them what i never had that whi i suppos hes run wild now out at night away from his book and studi and not live at home on account of the usual rowi hous i suppos well it a poor case that those that have a fine son like that theyr not satisfi and i none was he not abl to make one it wasnt my fault we came togeth when i was watch the two dog up in her behind in the middl of the nake street that dishearten me altogeth i suppos i oughtnt to have buri him in that littl woolli jacket i knit cri as i was but give it to some poor child but i knew well id never have anoth our 1st death too it was we were never the same sinc o im not go to think myself into the gloom about that ani more i wonder whi he wouldnt stay the night i felt all the time it was somebodi strang he brought in instead of rove around the citi meet god know who nightwalk and pickpocket his poor mother wouldnt like that if she was aliv ruin himself for life perhap still it a love hour so silent i use to love come home after danc the air of the night they have friend they can talk to weve none either he want what he wont get or it some woman readi to stick her knife in you i hate that in women no wonder they treat us the way they do we are a dread lot of bitch i suppos it all the troubl we have make us so snappi im not like that he could easi have slept in there on the sofa in the other room i suppos he was as shi as a boy he be so young hard 20 of me in the next room hed have heard me on the chamber arrah what harm dedalus i wonder it like those name in gibraltar delapaz delagracia they had the devil queer name there father vilaplana of santa maria that gave me the rosari rosal y oreilli in the call las siet revuelta and pisimbo and mrs opisso in governor street o what a name id go and drown myself in the first river if i had a name like her o my and all the bit of street paradis ramp and bedlam ramp and rodger ramp and crutchett ramp and the devil gap step well small blame to me if i am a harumscarum i know i am a bit i declar to god i dont feel a day older than then i wonder could i get my tongu round ani of the spanish como esta ust muy bien gracia y ust see i havent forgotten it all i thought i had onli for the grammar a noun is the name of ani person place or thing piti i never tri to read that novel cantanker mrs rubio lent me by valera with the question in it all upsid down the two way i alway knew wed go away in the end i can tell him the spanish and he tell me the italian then hell see im not so ignor what a piti he didnt stay im sure the poor fellow was dead tire and want a good sleep bad i could have brought him in his breakfast in
